ResponsesInList.Title: Automatic confirmation email, after enrolment on payment
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings, I'm sure this feature used to exist, but I'm now struggling to find it . . . I am using Moodle Cloud , have several courses set up, and have 'enrollment on payment' set up (and all successfully working).Â  All I'd like to do is have an automatic email be sent to each user after they have paid and enrolled. All clues and pointers welcomed.Â  Thanks! Warm regards / Ian

ResponsesInList.Title: Automatic confirmation email, after enrolment on payment
ResponsesInList.Text: @Ian Gordon I'm looking for the same thing, and just asked our Moodle Support representative about this. This was the answer I was given: - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - By default, I believe only the 'Manual enrolment' and 'Self enrolment' methods in Moodle include an option to send a custom welcome message to users when they join a course. The 'Enrolment on payment' method doesnâ€™t currently provide a built-in welcome message feature. It may still send users a payment confirmation (depending on the payment gateway used), but that message isnâ€™t managed by Moodle itself. Iâ€™d recommend doing a quick test enrolment through the payment method to confirm what notification, if any, is sent automatically. If no message goes out, one idea could be to include your own welcome text or course link in the payment confirmation email.

ResponsesInList.Title: Automatic confirmation email, after enrolment on payment
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Andy, Thanks very much for your helpful reply. In parallel, I 'road tested' my latest course as if I was a fresh registrant (to make sure that authentication, enrollment, payment, etc were all working smoothly. In short - yes, everything works, but there's no visible option to automatically send a confirmation email. In my case (using PayPal), I got a 'payment receipt' email, which closes the loop on the financials (allowing course participants to claim the registration fee back from their employer, for example). But, in terms of the automatic 'welcoming' from an academic/pastoral point of view . . . seems we are back to good old manual methods (daily check of the list of participants, then send an email). Not too bad, but not slick. All the best / Ian

ResponsesInList.Title: How do I set prerequisite courses for a course?
ResponsesInList.Text: I need to be certain that a student has completed one course before moving on to another. How can I set prerequisites in Moodle Cloud ? I have searched everywhere. This is such a basic necessity of ANY LMS site and have found on every other LMS I have used. Where would it be?

ResponsesInList.Title: How do I set prerequisite courses for a course?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello there. In some ways your post is also relevant to standard Moodle , not just MoodleCloud , as it is a frequently asked question. But I will leave it here since one possible solution involves plugins which you can't add to Moodlecloud. There is no standard way to be certain that a student has completed one course before moving onto another. A popular workaround is mentioned in the Moodle documentation : Can I make access to a course conditional upon completing another? where basically you set up course B with an enrolment key andÂ  in course A you use Restrict access and Activity completion to conditionally display the enrolment key in a Page once every activity in course A has been completed. This works, but if you haveÂ  a group of students who communicate with each other it would be easy for them to pass on the enrolment key to course B. But then - you would know - because the logs will show that they have not completed course A.

ResponsesInList.Title: Important Update: MoodleCloud Performance
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello MoodleCloud Community, Weâ€™re reaching out to update you about the recent performance issues that have affected some MoodleCloud sites. We understand how frustrating this has been for you and your learners, and we want to assure you that resolving these issues is our highest priority. After a thorough investigation, we can confirm that these problems are not related to any security breach or external attack; your MoodleCloud site remains secure and protected. Our technical team has identified several underlying causes that have contributed to slower performance in specific situations. In simple terms, weâ€™ve found that some parts of the system have been handling background tasks and caching less efficiently than intended. These inefficiencies have, at times, increased load on our servers and caused slower page response times. Weâ€™re actively working on a set of fixes that will: Reduce unnecessary background activity, helping pages load faster. Optimise how data is stored and retrieved , especially in courses with more complex structures. Improve memory management for users who access sites without logging in. Ensure commonly used information loads more quickly and consistently. These improvements are currently being finalised and tested. They will be included in the upcoming Moodle 5.1.1 release, scheduled for 8 December 2025 . Weâ€™ll send a follow-up update on that date to confirm the release and share any further details. Thank you for your patience and continued trust as we make these improvements. Weâ€™re committed to ensuring MoodleCloud remains a reliable, high-performing platform for you and your learners. Frances The MoodleCloud Team

ResponsesInList.Title: MoodleCloud and Scorm package error authenticating
ResponsesInList.Text: I am testing MoodleCloud standard and created a course with a Scorm package from a training vendor. This Scorm package works on our on-premise Moodle server , but when I attempt to launch the course from MoodleCloud demo site I am getting the error below on the training vendor site. The following errors occurred: Field 'username' or 'uid' is required. and " https://www.healthstream.com/HLC/connect/ConnectAicc.aspx?aicc_sid=zHiDO6vK3k&aicc_url=https://primewesthealth-training.moodlecloud.com/mod/scorm/ aicc.php&n=NoUserInHSTM &o=47fe53fe-3a55-e411-958e-005056b10f02&p=47fe53fe-3a55-e411-958e-005056b10f02&c=703dfc19-2480-eb11-80e0-005056b17c18&SE=D0217DAZT6&frameset=false" It seems like MoodleCloud is not passing the users user id to the training vendor. I can't seem to find the setting in MoodleCloud that would allow this. Any ideas?

ResponsesInList.Title: MoodleCloud and Scorm package error authenticating
ResponsesInList.Text: I may have found the Moodle settings that were causing the issue. Both were set to disabled. I have enabled both. "Enable direct AICC URL " "Enable external AICC HACP" Also, " AICC pass numeric user id" was set to Yes. I disabled this setting so that it was sending my user id to HealthStream correctly to authenticate.

ResponsesInList.Title: LDAP Authentication on Moodle Cloud demo
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Michelle, as far as I know you canâ€™t use LDAP on MoodleCloud, even in the Standard Plan, itâ€™s not supported because MoodleCloud doesnâ€™t allow direct server connections. If youâ€™re using Active Directory, you can set up Shibboleth instead, which provides the single sign-on experience orÂ OAuth2 is another simple option.

ResponsesInList.Title: unable to download csv course completion reports - moodlecloud upgrade issue ?
ResponsesInList.Text: I havent looked at this site for a while, but I'm wondering if someone can help please ? I have my own moodlecloud site and course. I dont seem to be able to any longer download reports of student course completion activities in csv format ? I last did it around May 2025, and am wondering if this is due to an upgrade at all ? I'm specifically referring to the activity completion report. I can no longer see this heading on my site ( see screenshot " activity completion report missing "? I've attached a partial screenshot of the type of edited report I was previously able to create ( I've left out the student names and their email addresses),Â  to hopefully illustrate my issue

ResponsesInList.Title: unable to download csv course completion reports - moodlecloud upgrade issue ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello there. Because you mention MoodleCloud I have moved your post to the dedicated MoodleCloud forum.. but just to check.. in order for you to see the course completion report in a course you need to have both activity completion and course completion enabled in that course. Can you confirm that is the case for this course?

ResponsesInList.Title: unable to download csv course completion reports - moodlecloud upgrade issue ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mary Thank you. I was previously able to do this, so assume that they were, before the upgrade, so I'm confused as to why it isnt working now ? But for me to check that they are enabled, are you able to remind me ( eg moodle documentation resources page no. ? ) where I should be looking to check this please ?

ResponsesInList.Title: unable to download csv course completion reports - moodlecloud upgrade issue ?
ResponsesInList.Text: From your course, click Settings and then scroll down to Completion tracking and make sure Enable completion tracking is set to Yes. Make sure you have some activities with activity completion enabled within their settings If you also want course completion click the More link at the top of your course in the course navigation and then click Course completion and click the requirements for course completion. This feature works fine on my MoodleCloud site so I suspect it is a setting in your course or your site.Â  Perhaps the MoodleCloud team will also reply to you.

ResponsesInList.Title: unable to download csv course completion reports - moodlecloud upgrade issue ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Mary, I've realised I wasnt looking for these reports under the heading of reports ! I've found what I was looking for under course completion reports. Thanks for the pointers, served as a memory refresher for me !

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Cloud Price Increase
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rick, Thanks for raising this. We understand that price increases can be concerning, especially for smaller organisations and individual educators. However, this may be a misunderstanding. It sounds like the $230 figure comes from the reference pricing shown in US Dollars on our pricing page . Itâ€™s important to note that MoodleCloud plans are billed in Australian Dollars (AUD) . For customers outside Australia, the amount charged in local currency will vary depending on exchange rates set by banks or card providers. Currently, the Mini plan is 340 AUD per year , which is approximately 230 USD at todayâ€™s exchange rate. This plan will increase to 380 AUD per year starting 13th August 2025 . We hope this helps clarify things! All the best, Christian

ResponsesInList.Title: table borders and Moodle 5.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Brett, I have a similar issue that has manifested itself since the update to Bootstrap 5. We have embedded PDF files hosted within our instance of MoodleCloud together with links to videos hosted elsewhere in the internet (mostly YouTube). ResponsesInList.Title: table borders and Moodle 5.0

ResponsesInList.Title: table borders and Moodle 5.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Brett, I reported this issue using Moodle tracker here: https://moodle.atlassian.net/browse/MDL-85699 . Your colleague Mikel MartÃ­n Corrales kindly provided the solution on the 11/06/2025. My mistake was assuming that the problem was with the iframe element and failing to examine the Bootstrap 5 migration guide properly ( https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/migration/#helpers ), whereas it was in fact three deprecated classes used by the container: - embed-responsive - embed-responsive-16by9 - embed-responsive-item Using the replacement ratio classes present in Bootstrap 5 resolved the issue for me.

ResponsesInList.Text: hi Brett, using some AI hints, I added this code in the Initial raw SCSS box: table[border] { border-collapse: collapse; } table[border] th, table[border] td { border: 1px solid #aaa; } Now all my tables have a border around their cells, but system tables (e.g. report, logs, ...) do not. ResponsesInList.Title: What is or is not included in pricing tiers
ResponsesInList.Text: why not get the free trial and then you can see for yourself. ie "try before you buy"? As for what types of activities are included ? like drag and drop stuff, multiple choice question, SCORM .. - MoodleCloud includes all the normal activities you get with a standard Moodle site (ie that you can download and host yourself for free). You can have unlimited quizzes (including drag and drop/multiple choice )They are standard. SCORM can be used in Moodlecloud but SCORM packages are created externally so you'd have to store it somewhere or use up your MoodleCloud storage. The standard, ie out of the box activites are here: Activities and the standard, ie out of the box, static content types (resources) are here: Resources

ResponsesInList.Title: What is or is not included in pricing tiers
ResponsesInList.Text: How about we share a little more info about you and what you have right now?Â  and what you do with your Moodle? These clips from you postings: I can't list my needs, because I don't know exactly what to ask Where do you host?Â  Ok, to provide name of hosting company.Â  What level of hosting do you have there?Â  Wouldn't hurt to share what operating system it is and what versions of PHP/ MySQL / MariaDB you are currently running.Â  Â Why is that important?Â  Â That stuff is the horse pulling your cart (your Moodle and other) ... I have seen folks who are now running EoL OS's, thus older version of PHP and DB engine and are at risk every day. What version of Moodle do you have?Â  How would you describe the purpose of your Moodle?Â  Who are the typical participants (target audience)? What levels of access do you have/use to your existing server (s)? (extremly) limited in budget And who isn't in the same 'boat' these days! :|.Â  As has always been the case, a DIY (do it yourself) instance of any software, cost less as you do more.Â  Â Remotely host where some other entity does the heavy lifting means you do less,Â  cost more and there are usually restrictions. already selfhost my nextcloud And how is that going for ya? Some personal experience assisting folks that had hosted with a Moodle Partner ... When they decided (for various reasons) to get off their Moodle Partner hosting and go to DIY, MP gave them a DB dump and an archive of their moodledata.Â  Â MP did not give them the code for their site.Â  If they had 'taken advantage' of additional plugins (not part of DIY moodle) those were problematic. 'SoS', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: What is or is not included in pricing tiers
ResponsesInList.Text: Having nothing better to do this afternoon ... and since Google is featuring it's Gemini now for just about everything, gave it a test ... Prompt 1: most used modules Moodle What is returned incudes this: In Activities (interactive items where students provide input) Chat: Enables real-time text-based discussions within Moodle. Chat is going away. In other popular Modules/Plugins: Adaptable Theme: A highly customizable open-source theme for Moodle. Edwiser RemUI: A popular theme known for its user-friendliness and customization options. Prompt 2: Best moodle hosting One will get quite a few 'Sponsored' hits. #1 wasn't services.moodle.com One link went to Edwiser article entitled: Top 12 Moodle Hosting Providers 2025 https://edwiser.org/blog/top-moodle-hosting-providers/ Guess which is #1? EdwiserCloud - hmmm, no brainer there! #5 is MoodleCloud Some biggy hosting providers are mentioned: HostGator, TMD, Bluehost, Hostinger Here's what the article said at the very end: So who really steals the show? Any Moodle Hosting requires an in-depth understanding of the usage pattern of Moodle sites. The choice of an ideal Moodle hosting service depends on the purpose of your Moodle site, the max number of concurrent users, amongst other such factors . Once you have zeroed in on these specifics related to your Moodle site, you will be in a much better position to choose the best-fit hosting provider . 2 things you won't see which could bite ... these are technical and below the water line of what makes a Moodle server: Inode Limits. Disk space ... where one is hosted, do they offer detachable data devices of a size you choose? Could list a few more, but think you get the idea? Then there is what access one has to those things 'below the water line' of the iceburg that is a moodle (and how much hands on you really want to do). A biggy ... DB server config and tweaks.Â  Â The more one can fit the DB for a moodle into memory of a server, the better. If you were to ask a hosting provider about those make sure you are talking to someone technical and not a sales type.Â  Sales will promise anything ... Techincal might not be able to provide with 'package XYZ'. Anyhoo ... 2 cents more? 'SoS', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: What is or is not included in pricing tiers
ResponsesInList.Text: It certainly sounds like you don't suffer from ' CLAS ' (command line avoidance syndrome) ... which is a huge plus when it comes to admin of a DIY moodle. There is a lot one can do from CLI - when you do decide on hosting ... IF self hosting, I'd strongly advise installing via git ... which is CLI only. Â Thus, that would eliminate some hosting options - if they don't offer at least a Terminal icon. Been my experience best to go with long term support versions of Moodle code. Â While every version Moodle releases is 'STABLE' think the LTS's are even more so. Â  I can be patient with the new bells and whistles ... some can't. Don't mean to burst your bubble ... but ... How much of a market is there for 'Non Violent Communication'? Couples, Families, Individuals, Workplaces, Leadership and Management, Therapist and Counselors, Educators and Students, other. A quick Google search shows you already have 'competition' ... udemy, https://www.cnvc.org/ etc. Is there an existing organization/site that is like a clearing house for such training/courses? How about colleges and junior colleges, trade schools, near you? Public/private schools? 'SoS', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: What is or is not included in pricing tiers
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Yes, CLI is fine, although It's cool when there is some GUI to ease some stuffs Yeah, I know about "competition" : Udemy provides pretty "light" generalities, and the official cnvc training courses are like 200-400 euros per weekend, things most people can't afford. I did, since I had a previous life where I was making pretty good money, I even qualified to become a trainer/facilitator, but... anyway, not goign into details.... I've not seen anything like I'm offering, and I've already beta tested with a dozen coaches who asked me to continue : they wanted to learn and practice more, and gave me some valuable feedbacks to improve what I already had. Now maybe they insisted because it was free for them )) As for the vettng or "clearing house", it's me, myself and I. That said, I have a pretty strong and diverse background, so it's not like I'm going completly blind or freestyle I don't plan on becoming rich with this (I don't plan on becoming rich, period), but I know the quality of what I'm offering, so at minimum, I'd like to cover my costs, and if there is a little more, that's great !! So I guess my (difficult) balance is here : I have no money to start, I'm not doing this for the money either, I like the diversity of what such project entailes (tech IT setup, video recording and editing, role playing for sketches...) AND, at the same time.... Each of these things are proper jobs on and by themselves, and while I build the server to eventually host the whole thing, I'm not creating and delivering my content.... I know it sounds like a "junior fun project", and in some ways, it is, but the reason I'm starting with DIY is actually because, first, I enjoy it, and then, I can't afford perfect and polished professional stuffs, knowing I might not cover those costs, because of competition and because I don't want these trainings to be so expensive that they are only accessible to middle and upper class (as NVC is today). So step by step, few learners, which hopefully will allow me to improve my courses, get better hosting plans and a little more bells, and a little more whistles, and maybe at some point go with a hosting provider, and/or video professional editor, and/or training designers.... Just one step at a time. Just to loop back on my initial question, that is why I needed a little more than what was shown on the official Moodle site ;)

ResponsesInList.Title: Understanding Question Banks since MoodleCloud's upgrade to Moodle 5.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Previously, MoodleCloud (versions 4.5 and earlier) had a single question bank per course. With the Moodle 5.0 upgrade , courses can now have multiple question banks , making it easier for teachers to share and reuse questions across different courses. With the upgrade, any existing questions from the course context are automatically moved into a new ' [Course name] shared question bank.' Additionally, any quizzes in a course with questions also have their own dedicated question bank, and listed under 'Other activities with questions'. Find out more in Question banks in upgraded sites !

ResponsesInList.Title: Unacceptable slowness in Moodlecloud - We need an immediate solution
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Andriele and other MoodleCloud Customers, Thank you for your honest feedback and for holding us to the standard you rightly expect. I want to apologise for the continued performance issues and the unacceptable impact theyâ€™ve had on you, your customers and all other MoodleCloud Customers. You are right to be frustrated. The lack of stability, slow load times, and lack of updates on the status page are not acceptable. I understand how critical this is for your business, and that this isn't just an inconvenience, but a real and urgent disruption. Hereâ€™s whatâ€™s happening: We are facing a combination of high user activity and unexpected traffic patterns that are overloading our infrastructure even as we scale it. Primarily, AI-driven crawlers and bots have been aggressively scanning and hitting your MoodleCloud instances' public pages. We don't believe at this time that the activity is malicious, as the web as a whole is increasingly seeing this issue. Previously, updating the robots.txt, a file which tells the web crawlers to ignore some pages, blocking certain IP addresses and browser agent IDs, and increasing resourcing has mitigated their impact. However, this time, each of these measures has been ineffective, the robot.txt is being ignored, ip addresses are being randomised, and each time the resourcing has been increased, the traffic has also increased to overwhelm the servers again. As it stands, the infrastructure is running 4x the resources we would otherwise expect to require for our normal operations, so this is financially impacting Moodle as well. This has been an ongoing cat and mouse game for some time as the traffic for most intents and purposes looks like normal user traffic. This led to our original incorrect conclusion that it was extremely large quizzes on a small number of sites, this delayed our ability to respond appropriately. Detecting this traffic and responding has been non-trivial. We have considered just completely block the pages which are being scraped, however, one of the primary pages is the policies that all your new users need to be able to access when they sign up due to GDPR regulations which has greatly complicated matters. We're now actively working on: Blocking and filtering out harmful automated traffic: We are continuing to make changes and implement additional filtering, and add further mechanisms to verify users on public pages are humans. You may see an uptick in the number of times you need to respond to a Captcha when accessing your systems. Infrastructure Scaling: We have already actively increasing server capacity, optimising database performance, and investing in more robust load balancing across regions. We will increase this further if required to provide the expected performance as further mitigation while the web crawler traffic still poses an issue. Optimising the platformâ€™s performance: including how interactive elements load under stress, this is an ongoing task but we have already delayed other project work to prioritise this for the foreseeable future. Updating the status page daily: so you're no longer left in the dark. This has been a gap in communication between our engineering teams and the support team which has been recognised and will be rectified. Unfortunately, our team was so focused on fixing the issue that communications with you, our users, has broken down, we will endeavour for this not to be the case moving forward. Realistically, when will this be fixed? Our current projections indicate we expect noticeable and sustained performance improvements over coming days, assuming no unexpected setbacks. However, I understand that it hasnâ€™t been soon enough for you, and I appreciate that you're having to take emergency measures â€” I donâ€™t take that lightly. We have some indications that steps completed late last night by our team have had a significant impact on the web server loads as you can seen in the monitoring graph below and we are optimistic that if this holds performance will be back to acceptable level soon but we will continue to monitor and implement further changes to prevent a reoccurrence in the future. Moving forward: I will also ensure your feedback and the feedback from everyone else are discussed at the leadership level, it has already been shared with both our engineering and customer support teams. You deserve a platform that performs the way you were promised. I canâ€™t undo what youâ€™ve been through, but we are committed to getting this right and we will keep you updated at every step. With sincere apologies and appreciation for your patience, Frances The MoodleCloud Team

Go to the Commit section of this guide to find out more about this stage of the improvement cycle and see related tools and resources.

As I say, this has been working with no issues, so I'm unsure why it has suddenly stopped. Would appreciate if someone could shed some light! Thanks Go to the Commit section of this guide to find out more about this stage of the improvement cycle and see related tools and resources.

ResponsesInList.Title: Collapsible buttons suddenly not working
ResponsesInList.Text: Eleanor The latest version of Moodle has upgraded the Bootstrap framework from Bootstrap 4 to Bootstrap 5.Â  Your instance would have been upgraded to the latest release recently.Â  This is to ensure that it remains secure, on supported libraries, and to give you access to the latest functionality.Â  It appears that you are using some classes which are not supported in Bootstrap 5, I believe data-toggle has changed to data-bs-toggle in the first instance, but there may be others. There are a couple of ways to fix this, the first is the obvious and edit each page.Â  This is probably the simplest and long term probably the best option as it will work for the life of Bootstrap 5 (V4 was released in 2018).Â  The second option would be to add the required classes to the SCSS setting in the Custom theme settings options in the site administration.Â  This requires some HTML/ CSS knowledge to do correctly but it will potentially fix the issue site wide.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodlecloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, We'd like to apologise for our recent slower performance you may have experienced with your MoodleCloud site. After looking into the issue, we found that the main reason for the slowdown was the very high demand on our shared servers from multiple quizzes with hundreds of users running simultaneously. This unexpected surge in quiz activity used up a lot of our shared resources, which then affected the performance of some other sites. Our team has been working hard to improve our system's ability to handle heavier than expected traffic, especially during our peak times across all of our locations. We are happy to report that after some time of monitoring, our services have been performing much better. We are always working to improve our systems to prevent such issues in the future, please let us know if you have any further questions by contacting our support team. Thanks, Frances

ResponsesInList.Title: quiz questions lost after update?
ResponsesInList.Text: The questions are not lost, but they have been moved by the upgrade process. In the Course category where the questions used to be, you should find a new course called something like "Shared teaching resources for category: Thinking". In that course, go to More -> Questions banks, and there should be a question bank with your questions. That is just what the upgrade does automatically. You can, of course, rename things, or move things around to organise them however works best for you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Two Front or Home pages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Vicki, Your Site Home ( front page ) is somewhat customisable, but creating different login pages for different users is not possible. However, you may want explore the options around grouping courses into Course Categories and having these available to specific groups of users ( Cohorts ) on the site. You may also be interested in exploring Custom Roles to create user roles (e.g. a 'Staff' role) which has a unique set of permissions ( Roles and Permissions ) suited to your specific business requirements. Kind regards, Barbara

ResponsesInList.Title: Important MoodleCloud Update: Chat and Survey activities to be removed
ResponsesInList.Text: We wanted to let you know about a change coming to your MoodleCloud site with the upcoming release of Moodle LMS version 5.0 , which is scheduled for early May 2025.Â Â You'll receive a separate email with more details about the update. As part of this release, the Chat and Survey activities will be removed from the Moodle LMS core. This means they will no longer be available in MoodleCloud sites once the update has been completed. What does this mean for your MoodleCloud site? After the 5.0 update, you will no longer be able to add new Chat or Survey activities to your courses. Any existing Chat or Survey activities will no longer function and will be removed from your site. If you currently use these activities, we recommend reviewing your courses and considering alternative options such as: Forum activity for interactive communication. Feedback activity for collecting responses from your learners. Thank you in advance for your continued support and happy Moodling! The MoodleCloud Team

ResponsesInList.Title: Paypal Gateway Error
ResponsesInList.Text: I am attempting to set up enrollment on payment for my Moodlecloud classes. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Paypal Gateway Error
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Hunter, I understand that you're getting the error "The payment gateway cannot be enabled because the configuration is incomplete" when trying to enable your PayPal gateway. From your message, you've entered your Client ID and Secret. Did you also fill out the "Brand name" field? If you did and the issue persists, and provided that you've double-checked that the Client ID and Secret are correct (no sneaky blank spaces, for example), please raise a request with the MoodleCloud Team from your Portal by following the instructions in the article Contact the MoodleCloud Team . Thank you, Christian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Paypal Gateway Error

ResponsesInList.Title: Display group membership in system notifications to graders
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Our students are assigned to different groups in our courses on MoodleCloud. Knowing the group membership of the students is important for the grading of their forum posts and submitted assignments. I am now looking for a way to display the group membership in the system notifications our teachers get, when the students make a forum post or submit an assignment. Can anyone help me with this? It would be highly appreciated. Esther

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Display group membership in system notifications to graders
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Esther, While notifications can be edited using the Language Customisation feature in Moodle LMS, this is not available in MoodleCloud. But if your teachers are assigned to groups within a course, they should only receive notifications for activities completed by the students in the same group (provided that the activity is set as "Separate groups" and that teachers don't have the capability accessallgroups - Please refer to Groups FAQ ). Best, Christian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Display group membership in system notifications to graders
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Christian Thank you very much for your answer, this is helpful. Kind regards, Esther

ResponsesInList.Title: How to see all submissions that need grading across an entire course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello! I am looking for a way for a teacher to see all the submissions that need grading across an entire course.Â  Specifically, if a teacher has graded assignments initially, but then students modify their submissions, it is difficult to find a list of what the teacher needs to go back to.Â  If I go into EVERY assignment, I can look at the Needs Grading count.Â  But I want the teachers to have a single place to look to see what they need to grade.Â  I have found mention of a Grade Me plug in in other Moodle help forums, but it doesn't seem to be available in MoodleCloud. Any assistance would be greatly appreciated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to see all submissions that need grading across an entire course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jen, To keep our Standard plan costs low and your site simple to manage, it is not possible to install any plugins on MoodleCloud sites . If the plugin or feature is essential for your organisation, you can upgrade to a Premium Solution - use this contact form to reach out to the sales team for Moodle Premium Solutions. Kind regards, Barbara

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to see all submissions that need grading across an entire course
ResponsesInList.Text: But is there a way to do this without a plug-in? It seems like the most basic function of an LMS -- allow the teachers to see what they need to grade. Can I do it with a report? A search? ANYTHING?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to see all submissions that need grading across an entire course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jen, According to one of our Moodle education experts, this is an often requested feature. Unfortunately, in core Moodle LMS, there is currently no way to see all student submissions that need grading across all assignments in a course (including marked and resubmitted assignments). FYI , the Grade Me plugin is often recommended for Moodle LMS users, however, even that is only assignments that haven't been submitted and not modified submissions. However, using the "requires grading" filter saves some time, when you go from one assignment to another. Kind regards, Barbara

ResponsesInList.Title: Weekly progress report to students
ResponsesInList.Text: We are on MoodleCloud. Moodle version 4.3.3. Our course is self-paced, meaning students can sign up anytime and complete the course at any time. We would like to send out weekly progress reports to all of our students to let them know which assignments they have completed and what they still need to complete. Currently, we manually e-mail every student individually. We run a course completion report and copy it into an e-mail to each student. This is time-consuming, error-prone, and not scalable as our registration numbers increase. I saw that there is a Participation Report where we can send a message for each assignment to students who have not completed the assignment. That means students who haven't started any assignments would get 26 e-mails, one for each of our assignments. That's not a great user experience. I saw the Pulse plug-in and believe that functionality is what we're looking for. However, we can't install plug-ins on MoodleCloud. Are there any options for us to automate sending out weekly progress reports? Or do we have to stick to doing it manually?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly progress report to students
ResponsesInList.Text: Why don't you use the Custom Reports to build that report. It has scheduling options; I have not looked at yet - but they appear promising. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly progress report to students
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, Shirley. I believe that Custom Reports will meet our needs.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly progress report to students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Season, I have been searching for a progress report for Moodle and my situation sounds similar to the one you were in last year. Could I ask if you were able to make a custom report that worked for you to send out to your students? Thank you, Alex

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly progress report to students
ResponsesInList.Text: If students are not regularly logging in to check their own status, I wonder if your emails are helping. However, I tend to teach adults, who I think should be responsible enough for checking their own status. Perhaps this is not your situation. How do you know that students are reading your weekly emails? Shirley's suggestion may help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly progress report to students
ResponsesInList.Text: We see a flurry of Moodle activity after sending out the progress reports.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly progress report to students
ResponsesInList.Text: The Completion Progress block is a nice option for both students to visually track their own progress along with the teacher able to monitor the entire class completion on a single page. This block uses the Moodle Activity completion functionality on the specific setting for successfully completing the activities . There are lots of benefits using this Completion Progress Plugin !

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly progress report to students
ResponsesInList.Text: We have this enabled.

ResponsesInList.Title: Weekly progress report to students
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm not sure if the Analytics system is available on Moodle cloud , but it could be another option. It can send a general message to users that they have upcoming activities due (it wont tell them what, but it directs them to the Timeline block on the dashboard which will display this information): More info here https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=454023#p1837306

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weekly progress report to students
ResponsesInList.Text: Just another approach that might be worth considering; Under Grades / Grader Report, there's an option to download grades given for each assignment to each student as an Excel spreadsheet. With a bit of VBA, this could be used to generate emails for each candidate showing which assignments they've completed, their scores and what is outstanding. You could also include a "student average" as a guide for them. I do most of my tracking using Excel. Ian

ResponsesInList.Title: discounts for Non profit organizations on Moodle cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, We're an NPO based in India working with 10000 students and are looking potential ways to utilize Moodle as LMS in the work we do. Kindly share any subsidies/discounts for NPOs working at scale and how can we apply to them. Let us also know the pricing model for more than 5000 active users.
role: Picture of Devi A S L

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: discounts for Non profit organizations on Moodle cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, Thanks for your interest in MoodleCloud . Please note that our plans go up to 750 users (see our Standard Plans in the MoodleCloud website). If you need to have more users than that, you'd have to either host your own Moodle LMS instance, or get a hosted Moodle LMS solution though us or a Moodle Certified Partner ( get in touch with our commercial team ). As for discounts for NPOs, our MoodleCloud Not-For-Profit/NGO program has been paused until further notice. So, we are no longer accepting or processing applications for free Not-for-Profit/NGO MoodleCloud sites. With regard to discounts for hosted Moodle LMS solutions, I do not have any information on that topic. You'd have to contact our commercial team to learn more. Thank you for your understanding, Christian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can log in to Moodle Cloud but can't access site
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Charles, This looks likes it might be only happening to your site due to some setting changes. Can you please open up a support ticket by contacting support via your MoodleCloud Portal and then our team can resolve this issue with you. Thanks, Frances The MoodleCloud Team

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can log in to Moodle Cloud but can't access site
ResponsesInList.Text: And it's down again. :/

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can log in to Moodle Cloud but can't access site
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Charles, You have some css and javascript code in the "additionalhtmltopofbody" configuration field that is causing issues. I had moved that code aside this morning, to make the site come back up. I presume you added that code back after connecting, because it's back in the database. You will need to fix that code, otherwise the site will keep being unaccessible. I would suggest either doing that on a local installation of Moodle, or - if you do it on this site - to keep the relevant admin page opened in a different tab (while you test in a different browser or incognito window), to be able to revert back to a working configuration when things break. Your site is back online now. Mathieu

ResponsesInList.Title: grader information/information for graders
ResponsesInList.Text: I've been searching for answers and playing with settings for hours and I cannot figure this out. Why can my students see information that I put in the grader information box in my essay questions in moodle?! My very honest students reported that the answers were there. How do I stop it?? They can also see my hidden information in the menu on the left side. How do I hide these? Thanks for any help in advance. Sarra Lev

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: grader information/information for graders
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Sarra - It is indeed strange because I tried on my own MoodleCloud site ( I see you are using MoodleCloud) and I couldn't replicate it at all - I made a quiz with an essay question and grader information but my student couldn't see the information (or the hidden sections ) I am sure you have checked all these already but can you double check: Site administration > Users > Assign system roles - to ensure students don't have any system wide roles that might affect this; Site administration > UsersÂ  > Define roles - to ensure there are no capability overrides on the student role as a whole In the course itself > Course navigation >ParticipantsÂ  and check the students have the role of student in the course and no other role; In the course >Course navigation > Participants and from the dropdown > Permissions and check the student role doesn't have any overrides. In the Quiz >More > Permissions and check the student role to check they don't have any overrides in the quiz itself.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: grader information/information for graders
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mary (if I may?) Thank you so much for your reply. I've re-checked all of those, and they all seem to be correct, though the one thing I remain unsure of is what items on the very extensive list of permissions would control these particular issues. Perhaps something that is permitted to students shouldn't be, but I don't know what. Any thoughts? Any suggestions about what I might do next? Thanks again, Sarra

ResponsesInList.Title: Customising language in Quiz on MoodleCloud/Alternatives to this

ResponsesInList.Title: Enrolment Email to New Students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, First, thanks for making MoodleCloud available! It contains the Welcome text that I created. And nothing else. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enrolment Email to New Students
ResponsesInList.Text: Did you already create this user? So they already have an account on the site? They need an account before you can enrol them into a course manually (unless you do it all via a spreadsheet) (Assuming you know the difference between enrolment and authentication - apologies if you do.) If you log in as administrator, you can change the welcome text by going to the course and clicking Participants > then from the dropdown Enrolment methods and selecting Manual enrolment. Change 'Send course welcome message' to something other than No and the custom welcome message will appear. You can add a link in there. See the video: Giving learners course access. (link)

I'll add the required details for the users. Ian

ResponsesInList.Title: How to restrict profile/course information access based on roles within Moodle Cloud (without Plugin)
ResponsesInList.Text: I am struggling to make the role restrictions work in the way I would like to support a local charity within Moodle Cloud . I have tried to use the Define Roles and the Allow to view checkboxes, to only show the corresponding centre role for the Admin role but that doesn't seem to work. Goal: To only show user profile information & course participant data to the matching Learning Centre Admin for for that centre. Overview: There are 8 different learning centres which share the same courses, so I am trying to restrict access so that each Learning Center Admin can only see the participants related to their centre as well as only see their user profile information including within reports. Other context : There are 130 courses under one Course Category and there is over 650 students assigned to multiple different courses. There are 8 different student roles which correspond to a different learning center names e.g "Atlas Student", "Falls Student" etc There are 8 corresponding teacher roles for the admins at each center so they can just view the users within their center. E.g Â "Atlas Admin" should only see user participant & profile information who have "Atlas Student" role E.gÂ  "Falls Admin" should only see user participant & profile information who have "Falls Student" role Hopefully that explains things enough but happy to share more info

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to restrict profile/course information access based on roles within Moodle Cloud (without Plugin)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi David, I understand that you've given the Admin role to the person in charge of overseeing each Learning Centre. As you can see in the article Site administrators , "site administrators have permissions to do anything (...) Â the role itself cannot be edited (...) It is recommended that you don't have lots of admins on your site." In this case, you may want to use Groups instead. There's a good discussion about this in the Teaching with Moodle forum: Restricting a teacher's visibility of content to only their group . It may give you a solid starting point. Best regards, Christian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to restrict profile/course information access based on roles within Moodle Cloud (without Plugin)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello David. First of all you don't need different student roles - just use the generic student role and as Christian said, explore the ' Groups documentation. I wonder what particular 'powers' your learning centre admins need to have? Because if they just need to have the editing Teacher or even Non-editing teacher rolein the course then look at theÂ documentation FAQ question: How do I restrict a teacher to view only information about the groups that they are in? Also if you need more information about roles, then there is a free Moodle Academy course: Moodle Role Management.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to restrict profile/course information access based on roles within Moodle Cloud (without Plugin)
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Mary for responding :D Yes I used the Student archetype for each of the student roles, the reason I named them after each centre was so that I could easily identify the users easily. I will change the archetype for Center Admins to Teacher or Non-Editing Teacher role, as I wasn't aware of the limitation of changing admin roles to have less permissions. So all the Center Admins need to be able to to do is: - Ability to only see the user profiles who are affiliated to their centre - Ability to only be able to add the users who are affiliated to their centre as a participant to a course - Ability to add a new user to the system and be able to assign them the right student role - Ability to view and change the profile information of a user assigned to their centre (just the custom fields and possibly email address)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to restrict profile/course information access based on roles within Moodle Cloud (without Plugin)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello again David. To be honest I don't think you can do exactly what you want to do with standard Moodle LMS - of which MoodleCloud is an example. Teachers can't by default add new users to the system. Admins and those with the Manager role can do this, but it is not possible to restrict visiblity to just their centre. How difficult is it for you or one trusted admin to do a regular upload of users from various centres via CSV? In the CSV file you can include the Group field ( and if the group is not yet made, then Moodle will create it so you don't have to. You can then use a regular Teacher or non-editing teacher role in the courses and with the permission restriction mentioned previously, they will only see the users that they are responsible for in their centre. Look at the video How can I enrol groups into my courses? However, if you don't want to do this then to have complete restrictions of each centre,Â  you would have to investigate something called Multitenancy which is offered by Moodle Workplace, supported by Moodle HQ like MoodleCloud . (Another possiblity is Iomad )

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to restrict profile/course information access based on roles within Moodle Cloud (without Plugin)
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Christian for responding! I did try to test this using Groups but it seems very tedious that groups only exist within courses and have to be manually created and manually assigned users to them when new courses get created as well as all existing courses. My ideal feature/functionality would be that we have 8 groups system-wide and then only allow the Centre Admins/Teachers to see all use information related to the users in their group. I am assuming this could only be achieved via a plugin.

ResponsesInList.Title: Install New Theme/Plugin in Moodle cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: We have setup new website in moodle cloud hosting. How to install new plugin/theme in moodle cloud ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Install New Theme/Plugin in Moodle cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Unless things have changed, you cannot install plugins in MoodleCloud. This is one of the disadvantages of using MoodleCloud, but it might also be an advantage in that you can focus on using the "true" Moodle and not run into problems with plugins.

ResponsesInList.Title: Sanjeev Mansotra | How can I Integrate MoodleCloud with Third Party Services?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello to everyone, my name is Sanjeev Mansotra. How can I integrate MoodleCloud with third-party authentication services (such as Google, Microsoft, or LDAP ) to streamline the user login process, while ensuring compliance with GDPR regulations and maintaining optimal data security and privacy for all users?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sanjeev Mansotra | How can I Integrate MoodleCloud with Third Party Services?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sanjeev, MoodleCloud supports the same core authentication features as the Moodle free software distribution. I would invite you to have a read of the "Google service OAuth2" documentation on https://docs.moodle.org/404/en/OAuth_2_Google_service to get started. This is working well on MoodleCloud. I don't have a site currently setup with the Microsoft authentication. You may have to test that one on your side. LDAP is not supported on MoodleCloud. Moodle Partners are better suited to offer and support LDAP connections, on their own hosting infrastructure, apart from MoodleCloud. Mathieu

ResponsesInList.Title: Bug Report: "Video source is missing" error with H5P Course Presentations
ResponsesInList.Text: Description of the issue: I have built a course in MoodleCloud with various H5P packages, predominantly using Course Presentations, Accordion, and Information Wall content types. There are no interactive videos included in the course. Until a few days ago, I was able to update these H5P content types without any issues. However, I am now encountering a "Video source is missing" error when attempting to open two of the Course Presentation files that I recently updated. The error persists despite several troubleshooting attempts, including: Editing the H5P content both in situ and via the Content Bank . Deleting and re-linking the files within the H5P activity. Re-creating a fresh H5P activity and linking to the files, or uploading the file. Replacing the files with fresh copies of the content or even newly created files. When attempting to copy the content from Content Bank > More , the editor displays settings related to Interactive Video , which seems unrelated to the content type in question. It feels like MoodleCloud is suddenly treating all H5P content types as if they were videos? Steps Taken to Reproduce: Open an existing H5P Course Presentation in the course. Make an update and save. Observe the "Video source is missing" error message. Impact: This issue has affected two of my Course Presentation files, making them unusable, and I am now hesitant to make further changes, as this course is set to go live soon. Additional Information: I do not have admin access to this MoodleCloud instance, but I am in contact with the administrator, so I can relay any site-level instructions if required. Request for Help: Could anyone suggest steps to resolve this issue, or at least determine what might be causing MoodleCloud to behave this way? I don't know whether this is a bug in MoodleCloud or a problem with the H5P integration. If this post belongs in the H5P plugin section instead, please (lovely moderators) feel free to move it. Thank you in advance for any guidance or support!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bug Report: "Video source is missing" error with H5P Course Presentations
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Aurelie, Thank you for your report. It appears that the site administrator has raised a support request. We will continue to handle this issue there. Thanks again, Christian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bug Report: "Video source is missing" error with H5P Course Presentations
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Christian, Thank you. It's not resolved. I hope it is straight forward to resolve. Many thanks AurÃ©lie

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: TinyMCE and spell checker

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: TinyMCE and spell checker
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mary First of all thanks so much for the speedy response - before I even had chance to correct my post. I have now got it working in Edge, Chrome and Firefox. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: TinyMCE and spell checker
ResponsesInList.Text: Can you share what that code was? I'm working on it now.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: TinyMCE and spell checker
ResponsesInList.Text: Never mind. What I did was go to lib>editor>tiny>js>tinymce.tinymce.js In that file, I changed: `registerOption('auto_focus', { processor: value => isString(value) || value === true });` `registerOption('browser_spellcheck', {` `processor: 'boolean',` `default: false` `});` to `registerOption('auto_focus', { processor: value => isString(value) || value === true });` `registerOption('browser_spellcheck', {` `processor: 'boolean',` `default: true` `});`

ResponsesInList.Title: Cannot Open PDF - Moodle Cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone After using Moodle cloud for any years and students were able to submit and instructors grade their assignments. Our instructors are getting and error Saying" Cannot Open PDF. The file maybe corrupt or is in an unsupported format. Is there anyone that can suggest a fix to this, to allow instructors grading these assignments to do so. PLEASE HELP!!!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Cannot Open PDF - Moodle Cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes we are the same! Is there a way to log an issue?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Cannot Open PDF - Moodle Cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: I too have this problem. I have sent a message to support and encourage others to do so. Let them know it is not a one off type of thing. You can do that by clicking on the portal on the right hand side and clicking on support down the bottom.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Cannot Open PDF - Moodle Cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Orane, Chantelle, and John, I was having this problem, too. I logged a trouble ticket, and I learned that the document converters plugins are disabled by default. I had to pick one and enable it. Here is what they told me: Go to S ite Administration > Plugins > Document converters > Manage document converters Enable either the LibreLamba or Unocov converter by clicking on the eye icon . Once the converter is enabled, the documents should be working within 24 hours. For me, this ended the "Cannot open the PDF" error on all submissions, past and present. Unfortunately, previously-submitted assignments just showed up blank in the window even after a week. (They were already graded, so I did not care.) Thankfully assignments submitted after I enabled the plugin have converted properly. I hope this helps! -- Russ

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Cannot Open PDF - Moodle Cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: I had this issue, but I believe it has now been resolved without users having to take any further action. Ian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inactivate/delete builtin policies
ResponsesInList.Text: Correct, on an on prem install you will have complete control over these policies. On MoodleCloud as this is a SaaS service we enforce these policies agreements as it is legally required that users agree to them for data processing and privacy reasons.

ResponsesInList.Title: How to find when a user was registered

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to find when a user was registered
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Paddy, This type of information is applicable to both Moodle LMS and MoodleCloud, and therefore can be found in MoodleDocs . As you have seen, the Logs in Moodle are activity reports. However, Moodle also have Custom reports , which allow admins to create and share custom reports from various sources/areas of the site. There you can create a report on Users with many options of related data, including the time/date the user accounts were created on the site. Hope this helps Kind regards, Barbara MoodleCloud

ResponsesInList.Title: how do I add a table that people will be able to fill out?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there ! i would like to know how do I add a table that people will be able to fill out in my course? I would like people to write 20 shorts sentences in a table. Thanks for your answers D.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how do I add a table that people will be able to fill out?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dean, Others might know if there is existing Moodle Cloud functionality to do this. Could you use a workaround: Insert an activity - a file for students to download - a table, either an Excel or a Word file that they can fill the 20 sentences in. Insert a second activity - an assignment, which gives them a drag & drop window to upload the completed worksheet / document into? It's a bit clunky, but it would work if there's no cleaner way of doing it. HTH , Ian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how do I add a table that people will be able to fill out?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dean, In addition to Ian's suggestion, depending on what you want to do with that information, you can use the Assignment activity and allow your users to upload their answers, use the Feedback activity , or even create a Google Sheet (use the publish file feature) and use iframe to insert it in a Text and Media area ; you'd have to edit the sheet's access capabilities and edit the src URL to make it editable while embedded. There are guides in the web. I'm sure that there are many more options to do this. Please feel free to explore Moodle's Documentation to learn more about these and other features. All the best, Christian

ResponsesInList.Title: Checking for Unmarked Assignments
ResponsesInList.Text: All, I've been receiving really useful help here - maybe this will help others in the same situation as me: Ona typical course, I have 40 students, each has between 8 and 24 assignments to submit. Going through Moodle, opening each assignment one by one and checking for unmarked assignments is a real nuisance. I have made a spreadsheet with a bit of VBA. It cycles through all assignment windows in a course and opens each one in a separate tab. I then run through the tabs, and any where "Needs grading" is not zero, I know I have assignments to mark there. Where I see a zero, I just close that tab. In seconds, I'm left with only the tabs where I have marking to do. To make this: Create a spreadsheet, save it as an .xlsm (macro-enabled spreadsheet) Select a range of cells - single column. Into the cells, copy & paste the url's of each grading summary page (the one that shows Participants, Submitted, Needs grading), one under the next. Name this range - I called mine " Assignment_URLs" Copy & paste the following code in as a VBA module: Sub Open_Assignment_URLs_In_New_Tabs() Dim rng As Range Dim cell As Range Dim URL As String Sheets("Sheet 1").Select â€˜Change this to the sheetname where the links are [Assignment_URLs].Select â€˜Named range where the links are ' Check if a single column is selected If TypeName(Selection) = "Range" Then If Selection.Columns.Count = 1 Then Set rng = Selection ' Loop through each cell in the selected column For Each cell In rng ' Get the URL from the cell URL = Trim(cell.Value) ' Open the URL in a new tab If URL <> "" Then CreateObject("WScript.Shell").Run URL End If Next cell Else MsgBox "Please select a single column containing URLs.", vbExclamation End If Else MsgBox "Please select a single column containing URLs.", vbExclamation End If End Sub If you aren't sure how to insert VBA, ask ChatGPT - it gives a good explanation and examples. To use the spreadsheet: Log in to Moodle as teacher. Run the code; it should open as many new tabs in your browser as you have url's in the named range. Hope this is of use, Ian

ResponsesInList.Title: Allow quiz to be attempted offline
ResponsesInList.Text: On my moodlecloud account, "Allow quiz to be attempted offline using the mobile app" sets itself to default "yes." ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Allow quiz to be attempted offline
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Sarra - just to clarify: You want your quiz to use sequential navigation, yes? You can do that but you can't have sequential navigation with offline attempts. So if you want your quiz to be attempted offline then you need free navigation. (If you click the i (help)icon next to the setting Allow quiz to be attemptedÂ offline using the mobile app, it tells you which features are available offline.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Allow quiz to be attempted offline
ResponsesInList.Text: (Just replying to myself for clarity here - I edited my previous post but only after it came via email. So basically: sequential navigation and **offline** attempts do not work together.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Allow quiz to be attempted offline
ResponsesInList.Text: It is also worth noting that with offline attempts at a quiz cannot use interactive feedback behaviours, feedback will only be given when the students re-connect. This is because the correct answers are not stored in the browser.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student Submission File Size
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ian, The free MoodleCloud trial site has the same features, options and pre-configurations as paid subscriptions do (only the storage and user quotas differ). With regard to your query of increasing the 1Mb limit, please visit our FAQ uploading large student assignments on MoodleCloud for more information. As required, you can explore and search within MoodleDocs orÂ our knowledge base solutions for instant access to all available Moodle information; as well as Moodle Academy for free Moodle training. The MoodleCloud knowledge base is also accessible via the Help Widget in your portal . Happy Moodling! Kind regards, Barbara MoodleCloud Team

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Admin user is UNABLE to login on paid MoodleCloud organization
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks very much, Brett.Â  I have. I guess from your referring me to the support site that the answer to my question (*) is that there isÂ no facility in MoodleCloud for the site admin (i.e. registered MoodleCloud user) to take the site out of Maintenance mode.Â  I thought that would be useful information for others who find their way here with this problem. (*) "Is there any way to take the site out of maintenance mode, as I could do on my own Moodle site, or does it require action by Moodle HQ?"

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Admin user is UNABLE to login on paid MoodleCloud organization
ResponsesInList.Text: Apologies, I misread that bit. No there isn't a way for an admin to take a site out of maintenance mode. The maintenance mode page is put in place to give students a nice page rather than an error when infrastructure work is required on MoodleCloud such as upgrades or more recently a database migration to ensure that the system was running on a supported and secure infrastructrure. This is why Admins can't turn off maintenance mode. Once the work is complete all sites should automatically be set back but on occasion one or two fail to do so. With 10s of thousands of sites its not always as easy as we would like to catch the ones that have not changed back. We are looking at improving monitoring to help mitigate this posibility futher.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Admin user is UNABLE to login on paid MoodleCloud organization

ResponsesInList.Title: HELP!!! SPACE NEEDED
ResponsesInList.Text: I am using moodle cloud and have taken over from another site administrator. She set questions that had student upload videos, I need to delete these submitted files as we are up to 90% of space. Please can someone advise. I have spent over 3 hours trying! Thank you

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: HELP!!! SPACE NEEDED
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sarah, Student submissions can take up a lot of space. Understandably, it is easier to prevent this by restricting the assignment submission upload size. Find out more about assignments , using assignments , and assignment settings . In your case, you have a few options, depending on your organisation's needs and compliance requirements. You could perform a course backup or an activity backup , and download these for safe keeping, and remove the course/activity from your site. Please refer to our article on restoring deleted courses for more information (especially the 100MB file limit). However, backup files do not allow easy or quick access to student work, if that is what you also need. If you need the course for another cohort, please refer to our information on course copy and reset course . If the course is currently being used, and you only want to remove the file submissions, then you could download the student submissions (in a zip file) and then delete the submissions . However, deleting a student submission will delete the grade assigned to that submission too! As a workaround, you could create an offline assignment just to enter the grades and feedback, to keep these in the system if you're removing the assignment with the large student submission files. If you only want to delete the submitted files, but leave the student assignment submission with the grades and feedback, then it is possible to edit the student submission and replace the uploaded file with another file (e.g. an 'empty' txt file). The issue with this, is that even though it is possible from a system perspective, it compromises the integrity of the student submission from an educational perspective. Also, it is exceptionally time consuming to edit each student's assignment submission. There may be other options or possibilities, feel free to explore Moodle Docs for everything Moodle can do. FYI , other articles related to storage in MoodleCloud are: Delete unused media files in MoodleCloud , and Optimise your MoodleCloud storage . Hope this helps Kind regards, Barbara

Default activity completion. Courtesy of the Moodle Users Associationâ€™s valuable input, administrators and educators can now set default activity completion conditions at the site level. ResponsesInList.Title: 'invalid' being added to email address
ResponsesInList.Text: Several user accounts on our MoodleCloud site have had an 'invalid' added to their email address. Why is this happening and how can it be prevented?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 'invalid' being added to email address
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dan, The .invalid is automatically appended to an email address when a bounce occurs if the sent email can't be delivered because of a permanent issue. For example, a bounce might occur if the user's email address is either invalid or the mailbox is full or unavailable (even an "out-of-office reply" has triggered this bounce). This information is supplied by AWS (Amazon Web Services), who we use to host all MoodleCloud sites and deliver site related emails. MoodleCloud appends a user's email with ".invalid" when AWS tells us the email address bounces. This is automated to avoid repeated attempts to send an email that is bouncing back. You can manually remove ".invalid" from the users' email addresses in your site and this should resolve the issue, unless the user's mailbox does not accept the email. The user should also check their email filters to make sure they accept (and not automatically reject) the email notifications from your MoodleCloud site. If your users use an institutional email, check your organisation's email server for filters that may have been applied that detect the email is from AWS/bulk email, and reject it. Regards, Christian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 'invalid' being added to email address
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, Christian, that helps. Although, one of the emails that was getting an 'invalid' tacked on was mine, dan@sabier.org, which is a manager account. There are some 'fake' emails I created for students who don't have email and will never use email and are just test accounts. The other email address also use the sabier.org domain name. Could Moodle or AWS be marking any email with that domain as invalide?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 'invalid' being added to email address
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dan, The ".invalid" is added per email address, as the system is notified an email bounced. There is no bulk operation done for a domain as a whole.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 'invalid' being added to email address
ResponsesInList.Text: We had the same issue, to stop tutors and admin staff getting .invalid when they went on holiday and had an out of office on, I instigated a rule on our email server that would not allow any email being sent to the noreply@ email address which sends all emails on behalf of the moodlecloud. This doesn't resolve the issue for learners, but did resolve the issue for staff. The main issue was that users aren't told that they are no longer going to receive emails, they just stop. So staff members missed assignments being handed in, and other announcements. We then do a monthly check on learners who have had .invalid added to their email address and see if something has changed. 98% of the time they have had an out-of-office on which has caused a bounce back.

ResponsesInList.Title: Workbook-type activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I have recently come across a tool called Wobo which basically allows you to integrate a digital workbook into your LMS. It looks great in lots of ways but is still quite new and unfortunately does not integrate perfectly with Moodle yet. As a small-ish charity we also don't have the funds to spend a monthly amount on it (even though it is very reasonably priced). I'm just wondering whether there is any way of creating a similar type of acvitiy directly in Moodle, on the MoodleCloud server . The kind of course which we run is one where students are required to: - complete self-assessment forms, which they may want to refer back to over the course of the programme - create action plans, which, again, they will need to refer back to, potentially make changes to, etc. - keep track of their progress by rating themselves on a scale for various parameters. Over time, this rating should improve, and they should be able to see this improvement The "Feedback" activity type does not work for these kinds of activities , because once submitted, participants cannot see their responses. The only work-around I have come up with so far is to ask them to download , complete and submit a worksheet as an "Assignment" activity, but this feels clumsy and I would really like these activities to be integrated. An online workbook like Wobo seems to be the ideal solution, but as I say, Wobo itself is not quite there yet. Does anyone know of a similar tool, or a good work-around on Moodle?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Invite manually added user
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Niklas, If you're adding users manually and want Moodle to send an email to them automatically, you'd have to select the option Generate password and notify user when adding the user. If you're uploading users in bulk , you can select Create password if needed and send via email in the field New user password. Moodle will generate a temporary password and email the user with instructions on how to log in and change it. Keep in mind, the standard message cannot be edited in MoodleCloud. I hope that this information has been helpful. Regards, Christian

ResponsesInList.Title: Tech support doesn't respond/ Video cache question.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have a moodlecloud "mini" account I think it's called which costs $201 US dollars a year. While there's no tech support phone number, I use the form fill-out. No one ever responds in last couple months. I have 512 MB of storage, but I'm almost maxed out with video. When I click on "users storage" I see duplicates of high MB videos which I uploaded. And I get a "Component" column which I don't understand, stating one of the videos is on the "mod_page" whatever that is. There is a column "Filearea" which will state "summary" or "content" which I don't understand and then there is an "action" column where there is a clickable "view in context " button, which is worthless, since it merely takes you to the general course content. Frustrating! Thanks for anyone's help. In short how do I clear videos duplicates out of my storage allotment, so that I don't max out my allotted storage?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Tech support doesn't respond/ Video cache question.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alan, I agree this is confusing, this was built using Moodle-specific concepts that are indeed not super obvious. While I can't help with the specifics of your site without knowing which one it is, I can at least clear up a few things: "mod_page" is a "Page resource", in a course. In a page resource, you can have files in either of the "General" section (the "summary" filearea), or the "Content" section (the "content" filearea). You'll see these headers by editing the Page element in your course), which will bring you to a screen similar to what you can see in the screenshot below (depending on the editor used on your site). On each of them, you can use Tools->Media Manager to access the files that are saved in that specific section, and delete them (they'll probably be listed under the "Unused files" list of that page). Please note you will have to save the Page to confirm your changes (using either "Save and display" or "Save and return to course"). The quota will be updated right away. Alternatively, if using the Atto editor, the "Manage files" tool can be accessed using the second-to-last button, just left of H5P.
