ResponsesInList.Title: GDPR defect: Privacy policy should not be agreed to
ResponsesInList.Text: When a new user (student) signs up in my site in Moodlecloud, the student have to agree to Moodlecloud's privacy policy. However, this is incompliant with GDPR . A person should not be forced to agree to a privacy policy. It's the controller's responsibility to process personal information in a compliant way and to make sure the data subjects get the information, but they cannot be forced to agree to the policy. Moodlecloud should change this. When I arrange courses in Moodlecloud, my company is the controller and Moodlecloud is a processor. The process should reflect this. A simple change would be to change the agreement to "I have read the Moodlecloud policy". That would be far better.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: GDPR defect: Privacy policy should not be agreed to
ResponsesInList.Text: Can't you just change the wording in the language settings?

ResponsesInList.Title: Sv: Re: GDPR defect: Privacy policy should not be agreed to
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the tip. I tired to log in with a new student account with swedish language settings on the site. Unfortunaly, the privacy notice was in english anyway as well as the text where the policy is accepted. Unfortunaly Moodlecloud doesn't allow customization of language packs either.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sv: Re: GDPR defect: Privacy policy should not be agreed to
ResponsesInList.Text: Moderator note: As this discussion relates to a MoodleCloud site, I'm just moving it to the MoodleCloud forum...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: GDPR defect: Privacy policy should not be agreed to
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for posting the query regarding this I've been speaking to our lawyers internally one of who is a specalist on this topic to get a full reponse for you. It is correct to say that Moodle does not put itself in the position of data controller for students (or other forms of data subjects) but acts as a processor for the controller (be it a university, employer or other organisation or individual). However, we also aim to provide those data controllers with the tools to meet their duties as seamlessly as possible. In instances, such as yours, where a data controller does not rely on consent as the legal basis for processing data through Moodle, or where it does rely upon consent but collects it through another means, acknowledgement of seeing the Privacy Notice would be sufficient. However, the consent box does meet the needs of those data controllers who are required to prove explicit consent. It exists to collect those records â€˜for the controllersâ€™, and Moodle is, as always, acting as their processor. There is a balancing to be struck between a series of boxes, which would address the various legal bases independently of each other, and ease of use and understanding for data subjects. We have currently taken the position that the crucial record to be collected is that of consent, and that it will also serve to acknowledge that the requirements of transparency have been met for Data Controllers not relying on consent. This is always under review and we appreciate the opportunity to assess our current position that your query offered us.

ResponsesInList.Title: Sv: Re: GDPR defect: Privacy policy should not be agreed to
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for giving such a great response. I think the proper way to handle these choices should be to make if configurable. An ideal scenario, for my company as the controller, would be to be able to configure my own privacy notice and link to Moodlecloud's privacy information. Even if moodlecloud is my processor, Moodlecloud in reality has the best information on how personal identifiable information is processed. Would be easiest to forward this information to the data subjects. When complying with GDPR, you have to choose a legal basis for processing. (See GDPR Article 6). In most cases, legitimate interest or public interest would be the proper choice. If you are running some kind of business legitimate interest is usually the way to go. You simply conclude and write down that your reasons to process personal information is greater than the data subjects' need for privacy in order to run the education. Public schools could use public interest. There are few cases where consent is the proper way to go. Consent is only possible when the choice is completely free. If you have to accept the policy in order to take the class, it's not a proper consent in GDPR. Sorry for being picky about this but I am a data protection legal specialist running a education business and not being able to be 100% GDPR compliant might reduce customer confidence.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud Copy Course Activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Jessica. I'm sure the MoodleCloud team will respond soon but in fact , most of what applies to regular Moodle also applies to MoodleCloud. If you want to copy a course activity from one course to another in MoodleCloud then you can use the "import" feature - go to the course into which you want to copy the activity and click the More link - then click Course reuse - then click Import. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Any way to increase Moodlecloud storage? 5MB/user is not enough
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Katherine, MoodleCloud offers cost-effective, standard hosting plans with fixed user and storage quotas for each subscription plan tier. These are ideal for small organisations requiring a simple, pre-configured LMS solution. If you require more storage or users on the MoodleCloud platform, your options are to upgrade to a larger plan, optimise your storage (only for resources, this is not possible for student assignment submissions), and/or suspend user accounts (suspended users do not count toward your MoodleCloud user quota). To keep records and evidence of student assignments, it is possible to download student assignment submissions and assignment reports. For more information read the '5. Keeping records' section in Using Assignment . If you require additional storageÂ  and/or users than what our MoodleCloud plans offer, you can use the fully customisable open-source Moodle LMS either as a self-hosted solution or a premium hosting plan with one of our Moodle Certified Partners . See our website for more information on MoodleCloud . There you will also find a link to start a free MoodleCloud trial where you can explore all the features to see if this is a suitable solution for your organisation. Kind regards, Barbara

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Google Drive linked content issue
ResponsesInList.Text: The site's config.php file in the root of the site can override settings from the config screens. I can' t think of anything particular to a cloud deployment that would require it to be set this way. in the config.php the lines would be those relating to $CFG->debug and $CFG->debugdisplay If you have access to comment out those lines then the admin interface would get control. There is a handy config.php line for $CFG->debugusersÂ  which takes a list of users who should always see debug messages despite the other settings. That can be handy for admins. There's no option to set it in the user interface though. More info here Debugging - MoodleDocs

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Google Drive linked content issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Dunno about MoodleCloud ... this info from a standalone, DIY 4.1.highest version of Moodle: Moodle settings, by themselves, won't work ... do check settings: in /admin/repository.php Google Drive Settings check: Supported files Default return type In ID issuer: Google /admin/tool/oauth2/issuers.php?id=1&action=edit where you have entered client ID and Client Secret Scopes included in a login request Default is only openid profile email Add to the scope: https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive On the Google end using the Google account you setup as the System Account. https://docs.moodle.org/401/en/OAuth_2_services API API's and Services Enabled API's and Services Google Drive API Is Enabled .... check settings. Also check Oauth consent screen Your error screen did not indicate if it were a file or a folder or what - and it won't.Â  Googles file system is very much like Moodle's in that there is meta data that displays humanly recognizable file names + extensions folder names but behind the scenes really a bunch of letersnumbers. On the google end, folders and files must be shared from the Google Drive screen. Example: "file_example_MP4_480_1_5MG.mp4" Shared with 'Anyone with link' as viewer is a url: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pILUKyQGgRrB7YECXJtUOovRrwHVPfuB/view?usp=sharing 'SoS', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migration from MoodleCloud to personnal server
ResponsesInList.Text: Okay. You are basically doing a "migration." Â Have you ever done one of these? Follow the directions to backup your MoodleCloud. Â On your server, begin by installing a new Moodle (experimental, right now). This proves that you know how to install Moodle on your server, and that your server meets Moodle's requirements. Â Your server version should match the MoodleCloud Moodle version (best). Â Then, I would replace your server's moodledata folder with what you download from MoodleCloud. Â Then, I would "drop" all your servers moodle database tables, and import the ". sql " file from MoodleCloud. I did see that MoodleCloud supports a few "plugins." Â If you are using these plugins on MoodleCloud, you should install them into your server moodle. Â Do you use any of these plugins?

ResponsesInList.Title: Finding files to delete them
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi We were trying to free up some space on our moodlecloud. In the file list we've got a few of these, but we don't know how to remove them. The PDF viewer on the grading page doesn't seem to work on our site so was hoping there was a way to turn it off.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Finding files to delete them
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sam, The file list usually indicates what type of resource and what course the file is in (but you still need to find the specific resource within that course). However, according to your screenshot, the location is identified as 'core', so would you please raise a support ticket from your MoodleCloud portal for further assistance with this. In general, to delete files that are associated with resources and activities in Moodle, removing the resource would remove the files. If you want to view and delete unused files from resources (but not remove the resource): open the relevant resource, select 'Settings' from the menu, select 'Manage files' from the Atto editor toolbar (as per screenshot), which will open the 'Manage files' pop-up - here you will see used and unused files (unused files can be deleted). With regard to the PDF viewer on the grading page (Annotate PDF feedback plugin), this can be omitted as an option when setting up assignments, or the plugin can be disabled in Site administration > Plugins > Activity modules > Assignment - Feedback plugins - Manage assignment feedback plugins Kind regards, Barbara

ResponsesInList.Title: MoodleCloud and Moodle Certified Integrations
ResponsesInList.Text: DoÂ Moodle Certified Integrations work on MoodleCloud?Â  I am specifically looking to use ReadSpeaker within MoodleCloud.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud and Moodle Certified Integrations
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Corey, MoodleCloud is our off-the-shelf, pre-configured version of Moodle LMS. It is pre-configured with only a few selected plugins and additional plugins cannot be installed. The flexibility of installing a wide variety of plugins to customise Moodle is a feature of Moodle LMS rather than MoodleCloud. If ReadSpeaker (or any other plugin) is essential for your business, you will need to use Moodle LMS . You can get Moodle LMS through a Moodle Certified Partner or you can download Moodle for free to install and host on your own server . Kind regards, Barbara

ResponsesInList.Title: OAuth Tenancy Error - Please Help
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I am trying to configure OAuth2 services in MoodleCloud and keep getting the below tenancy error.Â  I have followed the deployment guide to the letter and validated all settings but still to no avail.Â  If anyone can provide any help, if would be greatly appreciated.Â  I don't want to configure it as a multi-tenant for security reasons. https://docs.moodle.org/401/en/OAuth_2_services AADSTS50194: Application '2a7f35eb-6e79-4549-aa48-2cad6d09e1b3'(TEST Moodle Cloud ) is not configured as a multi-tenant application. Usage of the /common endpoint is not supported for such applications created after '10/15/2018'. Use a tenant-specific endpoint or configure the application to be multi-tenant. Trace ID: 7caef81c-faad-45ff-b04e-46ba8de17400 Correlation ID: 3e7c6e6d-8ef2-4567-8045-c6ea9b2d8e59 Timestamp: 2023-03-10 07:31:46Z Kind regards, Rich

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: OAuth Tenancy Error - Please Help
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rich, Sorry about the delay, I don't know if you have solved this already. In case you haven't, you may need to update your endpoints. The default endpoints for MS OAuth 2 services are configured for multi-tenancy, so if you are setting up single tenancy in Azure, you need to copy your endpoints from Azure and replace them in your site. See OAuth 2 Services - Further configuration options to read about how to change the endpoints in your site, and OAuth 2 Microsoft service - Additional Single Tenancy Configuration to see the extra steps required. Best, Christian

This will open up a support request where our support team can assist you. You will then be able to submit a ticket using this form: If you need something larger or more customisable than MoodleCloud offers, you are still able to contact a Moodle Partner in your region from the â€œChange planâ€ tab in your MoodleCloud Portal. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How can I host my site online for free?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello dear, I hope you are fine. We are a new initiative providing cost-free learning opportunities to women. Due to the lack of budget, we are thinking of hosting our moodle site online for free. Is there any way that can help us in this regard? We appreciate your response. Thank you in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How can I host my site online for free?
ResponsesInList.Text: " we are thinking of hosting our moodle site online for free" Hosting will cost someone somewhere some money, so the short answer is no. The longer answer is that there is relatively affordable hosting but that is really outside the scope of the advice you should seek here. You need to understand the essentials of what is required for Moodle and this is typically the LAMPP stack. To give you an example I pay around $USD12 a month for some hosting that might support perhaps 20 to 40 simultaneous users. But I have 20 years of Moodle and related technical experience. To economise on the technical support someone has to learn a bunch of stuff or you have to persuade them to work for free/cheap. The MoodleClouud offering mentioned in this forum is quite affordable and is delivered by the worlds greatest experts on the topic, so you should consider it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: cohort enrolment option not available
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello there. I think you might be looking at a video of an older version of Moodle. (Can you tell me where you got the screenshot from?) You need to go to your course and click Participants from the Course settings and then from the Participants link, click Enrolment methods. Then from the dropdown you click Cohort sync. So you are nearly there - you clicked Participants but you then need to choose Enrolment methods instead of Enrolled users from that dropdown to the left of the blue Enrol users button.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Cloud / remove unused files
ResponsesInList.Text: To save on file storage, I want to remove/erase/delete unused files. But how ? I can't find access to the repository.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Cloud / remove unused files
ResponsesInList.Text: You will need to delete the files from every location that they are located in. If you are using Moodle For School Theme: Go into your Site Administration settings Go into your Server files (Site Administration > Server > Files), select a file you want to remove and click â€œView in context â€, this will take you to the course where the file is located. You could also go straight to the course where the file is located. Turn editing on in your course Click the edit arrow next to where the file is (if unknown, go into each section of the course to try and find where the file is located) select â€œedit settingsâ€. Select Manage files. Select the unused file you want to delete and click â€œDelete selected filesâ€. Your files will now be removed from your Moodle site.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Cloud / remove unused files
ResponsesInList.Text: When creating Resources in Moodle/MoodleCloud, images and other files can be embedded for participants/students to use. Files for Resources are stored with the Resource. If you delete the entire Resource, your MoodleCloud site's cron should delete all associated files, as long as they are not being used elsewhere on your site. When updating Resources, selecting and deleting the image or file from the contents does not necessarily delete the file from the Resource. To see what files are associated with a Resource, but not used by it: Edit the Resource (Label/Book/Page/etc) Click on the 'Manage files' icon in the Content editor This will open the 'Manage files' pop-up: Here you can view (and manage) all files associated with the Resource. The 'Unused files' section identifies files that are still stored but unused. Select any you wish to delete and 'Delete selected files'.

ResponsesInList.Title: Collating several "Feedback" activities into one document
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I am wondering if there is a clever work-around on MoodleCloud to collate several "feedback" activities into one document. To explain - we are developing a child protection training, during which, at the end of each module, participants will produce a part of a child protection policy. e.g. in Module 1 they will be asked to describe the laws around child protection in their country, and to put this information into a "feedback" activity. By the end of the training, they will have filled in lots of these "feedback" activities and by doing so, will have written most of their Child Protection Policy. Is there a way of extracting the information that they give and collating it into one document? Ideally into a pre-existing template where their responses get slotted in at the appropriate points? If not, is there a work-around which would achieve the same results? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Collating several "Feedback" activities into one document
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Eleanor, This is not going to be achieved with normal Moodle function due to the Feedback activity being created for Feedback and not document building. You will need to develop a custom report/function to collect al the responses from the user in that course and place it in one document for you. Seeing that Moodle already has the responses and information, I cannot see why this will be too difficult to develop. The bigger issue now is that you are on Moodle Cloud and it does not allow any custom development. You will need to host the site yourself or ask a certified Moodle partner to host it and help develop this for you. I work for AOSIS, a South African Moodle partner and we can help with both the option I mentioned.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Collating several "Feedback" activities into one document
ResponsesInList.Text: This topic is known in the online business as the portfolio, "a selection of a student's work (such as papers and tests) compiled over a period of time and used for assessing performance or progress" (Source https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/portfolio ). Moodle is not designed primarily to be a portfolio, as you have realized. Still there could be limited solutions within Moodle. For example you can create a "cohort course". Say the full intake of a certain year/semester is also enrolled in this course. You keep that course running till they graduate. Depending on how mature they are, the students might like or dislike shifting a summary of their work from the (detailed) courses to this central course. The plus side is, the students do it themselves, you the teachers, don't have to copy things between courses.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud Subscription - 45 days Trial
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jonathan, If you'd like to upgrade prior to the end of your trial, you are welcome to do so from the MoodleCloud portal as follows: Log in to your MoodleCloud Portal . Enter your site name and your MoodleCloud password (which is the same as the admin password for your MoodleCloud site). If you are in the EU or UK, please ensure your VAT number is correct (If applicable) Click on the Upgrade button to take you to the Change plan section. Select the plan you need. Confirm your payment details to complete your purchase. Click on Pay now. As for the price, that depends on the plan you subscribe to. Please note that our plans have a set limit for users and storage and we do not have any extra addons just for users. On the other hand, you'll have the ability to suspend users to not count towards your quota. If you estimate that your site will have 125-150 users, then you might be interested in subscribing to the Mini plan which comes with 100 users and see if you are able to fit all the needed account with the ability to suspend users. If that is not enough, then you'd be able to upgrade at any point to a larger plan that could fit more students. I hope this information helps. If you have any further questions, please let me know or visit our FAQ page . Kind regards, ZuriÃ±e The MoodleCloud Team

ResponsesInList.Title: capturing individual reactions in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello. Is there any way to capture linger time and revisit time in moodlecloud?Â  Are there any predictive analytics available? thank you. Carolyn

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: capturing individual reactions in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Carolyn, MoodleCloud records a log of all course and/or site activity. These are accessible either from the menu within a Course (Reports > Logs) or as site administrator (Site administration > Reports > Logs). These logs are actions (clicks) only and does not include length of time a user may have had that page open on their screen. The report offers filter options and you can also download these logs (download link is at the bottom of the log report page) for further analysis. Kind regards, Barbara

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Christian, Solving this issue is not something I can help you with. But I might be able to help you with providing Francis team has information to solve the issue on your behave, and with that preventing you bump in another one - because this seems to be more likely a server configuration issue then Moodle software related.. So maybe you got time to answer these questions: If you go to a different course, and try to open the Question bank, do you get the same and/or other error? if not that it is isolated to this course, which I am doubtfull on but good for them to know. Are you able to turn on Debugging > debug message: Developer: extra Moodle debug messages for developers? (You can find this setting by going to Site Administration > Development > Debugging. You can also visit this page by editing this url to your environment: https://YOUREVENIROMENT/admin/settings.php?section=debugging) If you succesfull turned debuggin on, are there any messages showing up. If so share them with Francis and her team. With debuging on, try to go the question bank again within the course where it was not working. If you see any debugging messages please share them with Francis and her team. You can turn debuggin off now, by revisiting the page and switch debug messages to: Do not show any error or warnings. Can you know visit the "Enviroment" page, you navigate to this in the following way: Site administration > Server > Enviroment, or edit this url to your environment:Â https:yoururl/admin/environment.php? if you can visit this page: is every line showing status "OK" , if not please share which are not okÂ with Francis and her team. If you are in contact with Frances and her team through different channels, I would suggest sharing the outcome of these questions directly with her and not through the forum. I hope the team will respond quickly to you to solve this issue. -Gemma

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Bonjour Christian, I'm also part of the MoodleCloud team and had a look at your site. After a "purge all caches", accessing the question bank for the course I see on your site seems to load the question bank correctly as far as I can tell (meaning, I see a long list of questions on "/question/edit.php?courseid=5"). If there are other questions that are not loading correctly, or I misunderstood the problem, please let us know. This issue is known to the developers and a fix is being tested. All the details are available on the Moodle Tracker : https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-74762 . MoodleCloud will deploy the fix once the development team has confirmed it's good to go. Unrelated to this issue, the php XML -RPC extension can be safely disabled by going to "/admin/settings.php?section=webserviceprotocols" on your site. When MoodleCloud upgraded to Moodle 4, we chose not to force disable this extension on all sites, since a few of them might still be using the XML -RPC protocol. We will most likely disable it over all sites in a later upgrade, once everyone has had a chance to notice the deprecation and move on. Merci pour votre patience, nous sommes dÃ©solÃ© pour les inconvÃ©nients, Mathieu

ResponsesInList.Title: Exporting Grades in Moodle 4.01
ResponsesInList.Text: On moodlecloud pre update when we went to the grader reportÂ  and chose to export the grades, we were first saw the checklist export, with a submenu to move to the excel grade export. Now the submenu doesn't appear, so all we can export is checklists but not the actual grades. Is there a way around this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exporting Grades in Moodle 4.01
ResponsesInList.Text: We are having the same problem and are required to download our grades today.Â  Please let us know how to download student grades please, at this time we can only download that they have clicked the box to say they have read guidelines to start the course - this is useless as if they had not they could not have done the course and gained a result. A quick resolution please Thank you Christine

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exporting Grades in Moodle 4.01
ResponsesInList.Text: This appears to be a bug that is being looked into. In the meantime if you modify the URL , you can get to the export link for excel e.g. https://.moodlecloud.com/grade/export/checklist/index.php?id= Change the value of "checklist" in the URL to "xls" to get the format options e.g. https://.moodlecloud.com/grade/export/xls/index.php?id=

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exporting Grades in Moodle 4.01
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for this workaround. I ran into this issue today. Grade export was working fine in Moodle 3.11 before the upgrade to Moodle 4.0.1. Here are the specifics of my experience in case it's helpful to anyone else. In Site administration > Grades > General settings, I have "Primary grade export methods" set to "OpenDocument spreadsheet" and "Excel spreadsheet." Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exporting Grades in Moodle 4.01
ResponsesInList.Text: The reason that checklists show up is that it is an additional plugin ( https://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?plugin=gradeexport_checklist ) included with MoodleCloud that is not part of Moodle core and is what is causing this to appear first. On that note, the reason why there isn't a public tracker for this one is that it is being internally worked on by the MoodleCloud team as it relates to this additional plugin and isn't a core Moodle issue.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exporting Grades in Moodle 4.01
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, Praj! That's very helpful. I appreciate your explanations about why the issue is happening and why there is no tracker for it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Why Are Notifications Delayed?
ResponsesInList.Text: Update: The notification arrived at about 1pm, so that's a 22 minute delay. Is there any way to eliminate this delay?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Why Are Notifications Delayed?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Andrew, Site notifications are usually sent a minimum of 30 minutes after submission in Moodle, but with a MoodleCloud site, it will not send until the cron service runs for your site. You can find more information on this topic from the following solution articles: Set up MoodleCloud site activity notificationsSet up MoodleCloud site activity notifications and When crons run in MoodleCloud sites . I hope this information helps. Regards, ZuriÃ±e

ResponsesInList.Title: Navigation Drawer and Custom Menu Drop-Down not working!?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, Thanks in advance for any help you can give me, I've been puzzled by this for a while. To get started, my understanding of css and scss is extremely limited to being able to find the element I want to change in the Inspector and muddling my way through until I get the desired result...so you know where my knowledge level is at. Scenario : I have built an e-learning site using Moodlecloud. The hardware and browser the site is going to be accessed from is a Panasonic Toughpad FZ-M1 running MS Edge. The User profile is locked down so I cannot use another browser, and I cannot change the hardware either. Issue : When I access the site using Edge on the Toughpad, the hamburger menu and the custom drop down menus do not work. If I tap on them a box appears around the outside of the menu item, but the side-drawer nor the drop-down menu shows. I have narrowed down the issue to the pseudo-class focus-within, which I have found here: https://mysite.com/theme/styles.php/boost/1652874062_1649605921/all (The site is hidden behind a login page so I'm not sure how useful sharing the link to the site would be?) And it looks like this: .dropdown-item:focus-within {outline:0;background-color:#EEBC1D;color:#fff}.dropdown-item:active a,.dropdown-item:hover a,.dropdown-item:focus a, .dropdown-item:focus-within a{color:#fff} I think I may have found a potential workaround here , but I have no idea how to implement this to affect the hamburger side-menu and my custom drop-down menus. This is an absolute deal-breaker, as aforementioned I cannot change the browser or the hardware. Any help would be much appreciated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Navigation Drawer and Custom Menu Drop-Down not working!?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Matt, we had the same/a similar annoying flaw. Our workaround was adding the following code to "Within HEAD" section at Site Administration > Appearance > Additional HTML: <style> .dropdown-item:focus-within a { color: #00b894; } .dropdown-item:hover a { color: #000; font-weight: bolder; } </style> Don't forget to clear caches.

ResponsesInList.Title: MoodleCloud Sites are now on 4.0.1!
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, We're happy to announce that all MoodleCloud sites are now on Moodle 4.0.1! Moodle has a new personality! Welcome to a new contemporary interface, intuitive tabbed navigation, and a redefined course experience that makes it easier for educators or trainers to create and edit courses and for learners to reduce distractions and prioritise course work. Whatâ€™s new on Moodle 4? Connect your site with MoodleNet MoodleNet is an open, social, media platform for educators to share and curate collections of open educational resources. With this new update, youâ€™ll be able to easily send ready-to-use content from MoodleNet to your site. Learn more about how to use MoodleNet on MoodleCloud in our knowledge base article . Once your site has been updated, youâ€™ll receive an email that confirms that MoodleNet has been enabled for your site. Theme Changes The Classic theme is no longer available on MoodleCloud and the Boost theme is set as the default. If you have used custom CSS to style your site, any custom CSS that goes with the Classic theme also is removed. You can learn more about what to do with your custom CSS in our knowledge base article . Enhanced course creation experience New navigation to find your way around the course and activities with clear tab menus. Drag and drop sections and activities to organise your content in seconds. Enhanced support for screen readers and keyboard navigation to make your courses more accessible. Check out all new features for teachers in Moodle 4 . New features for Moodle administrators Custom reports: easily create reports at user, course and site level in a new drag and drop interface and share them with your team. Site configuration presets: keep things simple and remove anything your users donâ€™t need with just one click. Plus, save your site configuration as an exportable Preset to import into other sites. Customised login page: add a background image for the improved login page Check out all the new features for administrators in Moodle 4 . Thanks for using MoodleCloud and we hope you like the new features! Cheers, Frances MoodleCloud - Product Manager

ResponsesInList.Title: MoodleCloud - PayPal enrolment and tiered pricing
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings all. Is it possible in Moodle Cloud to set up PayPal auto enrolment with some type of tiered pricing scheme, so that different groups are charged different amounts?Â  So, for example, students are charged a lower cost than professionals?Â  Or would I have to create different versions of the course and use some other tool to direct the appropriate people to the appropriate course? Thanks in advance for your help!Â  (If this has been answered somewhere else I apologize; I did a search but failed to find anything.) Mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud - PayPal enrolment and tiered pricing
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Michael, Apologies for our late response. PayPal is part of the standard MoodleCloud account, so you don't need to install a plugin to use it, just enable it. How it works is that each student or user will need to create an account first. You can read more here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/PayPal_enrolment You can read more about setting up PayPal on your site here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Set_up_payment You can read more about PayPal Side setup and enabling PayPal enrolment here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/PayPal_enrolment As for your question, you are not able to have different prices for the same course. For this reason, the best solution would be what you had suggested, creating a duplicated course instance with a different enrolment price. I hope this information helps. If you have any further questions, please let me know or visit our FAQ page . Warm regards, ZuriÃ±e

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: File Size
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Lazar, Our MoodleCloud plans have strict limits and our max file storage means the maximum storage for your entire site. The individual file upload size is set to 100 MB across all file types and plans. Unfortunately, this cannot be changed. This includes: Course restore uploads, Image and video uploads, and File uploads MoodleCloud is designed with an optimal User Experience in mind, so, in order to make it simpler to use, we have disabled some features and options that may be available in a self-hosted Moodle install. In order to optimise your storage limit and upload limit, we recommend you read our solution article on MoodleCloud file storage . Your best option in this case would be to upload your video in an external file hosting service and then link it to your site using theÂ Resource URL .

ResponsesInList.Title: Changing URL
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Simple question here as my team has built our course and is ready to upgrade to the paid version of Moodlecloud. Unfortunately, we'd like to change the URL of the site. Is this possible? If so, how would we go about doing this. Thanks for your help!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Changing URL
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Craig, When you sign up for MoodleCloud you need to choose a site name which can only be changed by contacting us. You select your site name when you sign up for MoodleCloud (ie. yourchoice.moodlecloud.com). MoodleCloud does not support other types of domains. If you want a customized URL (e.g. sitename.com) you will need to contact one of our Moodle Certified Service Providers who offer paid services and alternative hosting options. If you wish to change your existing site name, this is available for paid MoodleCloud subscription sites - please contact us for details. Best Regards, Craig R Morton

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sv: Re: Sv: Re: Sv: Re: What to do in Moodlecloud? Re: Bulk upload of users - no email
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Maria, Just checking to ensure that you have resolved your issue with users not receiving their email. A common issue we find in MoodleCloud is that when uploading users from CSV, administrators often don't have the data in the correct format. When logged in from Site administration / Users / Upload users, an example text (.csv) file is available. It includes can be downloaded and adapted to your needs. The sample fields are: username,firstname,lastname,email Additional fields can be added as below. If you choose to enrol in course/cohort then they must already have been manually created before the CSV upload occurs: username,firstname,lastname,email,course1,group1,cohort1 I have seen it where sometimes the order of these fields are changed, or additional fields are added in the first column that stops it from working. You can read more here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Upload_users#Valid_upload_file_for_testing I hope that this helps. Warm regards, Kelly

ResponsesInList.Title: Backing up in Moodle Cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: How do I set the backup directory if one does not have access to the filesystem? Is it possible to download a Moodle cloud site via ssh/rsync? Is it possible to backup a Moodle cloud site to an external site ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Backing up in Moodle Cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jobst. You can setupÂ Automated Course BackupÂ inÂ any paid or 45 Day Free Trial MoodleCloud sitesÂ (note that Automated Backup is disabled in pre-2018 free sites). To setupÂ Automatic Course Backups: Go toÂ Administration > Site administration > Courses > Backups > Automated backup setup. Set backup auto_active toÂ Enabled. Make selections (below are some you may want to consider) Select the days of the week to run the backup Set the execution time for the backup process. For most servers, early morning will be the best time. Keep in mind the time zone your server is using. Select the maximum number of backups kept (default is 1) Select if you would like the course name in the backup title (default is No) Select if you would like to Skip courses not modified since previous backup. ClickÂ Save Changes After Automated Backup has run you will need to go toÂ  go toÂ Site Admin - Server FilesÂ and find the automated backup file/s (MBZ) and download to your computer. TO RESTORE A COURSE Go toÂ Site Admin / Courses/ Restore CourseÂ to upload that file and Restore a course. You can learn more about backup and restore here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Backup https://docs.moodle.org/en/Course_restore and about setting up automated course backup on MoodleCloud https://docs.moodle.org/en/Automated_course_backup#Automating_course_backups You will receive a regular email to let you know the status of your backups. You don't need to worry about those that are skipped (they have likely not changed since last backup) the important thing is to go to the Site's Server Files regularly and download the Backup files to your computer. This way if you site or course is deleted then you have the Backups. When you receive an email about your automated site backup, and some backups show as â€˜pending statusâ€™ this indicates exactly that, a backup is waiting to be made. There may be an existing older backup though. There should be a report here: https://XXX.moodlecloud.com/report/backups/index.php listing all the backups.â€˜Greenâ€™ indicates everything is OK, â€˜Skippedâ€™ happens because nothing changed in the course. You can also click the icon next to the course name, and it'll say if it's OK or not. If you would like to confirm, you can browse to: https:/XXX.moodlecloud.com/backup/restorefile.php?contextid=1 (assuming that course ID for that course is 1) and click â€˜Choose a fileâ€™ under â€˜Import a backup fileâ€™, then under â€˜Server filesâ€™ you can expand the trees to eventually see all the backups for a course. TO BACKUP TO AN EXTERNAL SITE - SITE EXPORT You are not able to download via ssh/rsync unfortunately, instead we offer an export feature. You can find your MoodleCloud export feature in your MoodleCloud Portal. The MoodleCloud Portal is where you manage your MoodleCloud account, billing details and access statistics on the usage of your site. LoginÂ to the MoodleCloud Portal Enter yourÂ site nameÂ and yourÂ passwordÂ (the same as your MoodleCloud site) Click onÂ â€˜Toolsâ€™Â tab 4. Click on â€˜Export this siteâ€™ 5. You will receive an email when the export is completed 6. In your MoodleCloud Portal, Click on the "your portal" link to download the file. Kind regards, Kelly

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Backing up in Moodle Cloud

ResponsesInList.Title: Strange icons in my menu
ResponsesInList.Text: Can anyone tell me how to get rid of the icons between every item in my menu?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange icons in my menu
ResponsesInList.Text:
Which Moodle version is this? Is this a new site? Or an existing site where the problem suddenly started happening? If the latter, was anything changed around the time the problem started? The Config Changes report may help identify recent changes. It's probably worth trying purging caches in case there's something in the cache that's out of date. If it's still not working then if you open your browser's developer tools do you see any errors in the
console or any resources that do not load with status 200 OK? For example on Firefox errors might be seen in the Web Console , and resources' loading status can be seen in the Network Monitor . Which theme does the site use? If it's not Boost or Classic, try switching to Boost and see if the problem still occurs. The F0/DA squares are probably supposed to be the â–¸ (fa-caret-right) icon in Font Awesome so presumably there's some problem loading the fontawesome-webfont.woff2 file for your site.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange icons in my menu
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for answering so quickly. It's my moodlecloud site, and it happened when the last update happened. I wouldn't have a clue how to determine the answer to the questions you ask about developer tools. I will try looking in the link you put in about the cache and see if that helps. The theme is whatever moodlecloud defaults to.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange icons in my menu
ResponsesInList.Text: ...in which case, moving to MoodleCloud forum.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange icons in my menu
ResponsesInList.Text: Clearing the cache did not work, but switching themes did. It must be a thing with the moodlecloud theme. Thank you for the suggestion! Sarra

ResponsesInList.Title: Student Log In Error
ResponsesInList.Text: We had an issue with a student attempting to use their Google log in, instead of the password provided in their welcome email. He was able to log in this way, but was not enrolled in my course, so could not access anything. Fast forward two days. Now he is receiving an error that he is logged in on another device (he isn't), and cannot log in again. When he tries to reset his password, it tells him he can't, as he is logged in elsewhere. Thoughts?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student Log In Error
ResponsesInList.Text: That error about being logged in on another device means that he is trying to log in by pressing the Google button (and he can't change his password because he is using his Google/Gmail acccount and can only change it there) If you made him a new account you need to tell him to log in via the normal login fields and not to press the GGoogle button.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student Log In Error
ResponsesInList.Text: He was not using the Google button, he was typing in his log in, and typing in the password he chose 2 days ago. I specifically told him not to use the button since that seemed to be the thing that got us into this mess.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student Log In Error
ResponsesInList.Text: Could you confirm this is on a MoodleCloud site please? Either way, it's not really specific to MoodleCloud so I'll probably more it into the General help forum shortly When you made him a new account a couple of days ago, did you create it manually - can you look to see at his account and see if it says "Manual accounts" next to "Authentication method" in Site administration >Users >Browse list of users?

When he attempts to log in to Moodle Cloud he gets the error. I have checked and it says Manual Accounts. He is enrolled in my class and I can see his activity from earlier this week.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student Log In Error
ResponsesInList.Text: When you say you need him to be logged into MoodleCloud , you mean you need him to be logged into your website, which happens to be hosted by MoodleCloud yes? So have you actually seen him go to your website and click the log in page and type in lbrewster plus whatever password you gave him, as in the screenshot of my MoodleCloud site?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Student Log In Error

ResponsesInList.Title: Auto-delete inactive users?
ResponsesInList.Text: Is there a way on Moodle cloud to auto-delete user accounts that have been inactive for a specified period of time. I don't mean to unenroll or inactivate participants in a course. I mean to delete the user account all together.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Auto-delete inactive users?
ResponsesInList.Text: HI Laurie, You can manually delete user accounts permanently (Log in as Site Administrator, Click Site Administration, Click Users, Browse list of users, then click delete icon (bin) next to the user you want to delete. There is no auto-delete feature.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Auto-delete inactive users?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Laurie, Maybe this plugin is what you are looking for: https://moodle.org/plugins/tool_usersuspension/versions I share this with the note that you have to be absolutly sure that you want to do this automatically, since well - code just does what we tell them to do, and restoring accounts is A) not easy en B) full with risks since you will not always get all the data back (especially using GDPR rules). You can also choice for creating a report in Moodle that shows you the accounts that have not been used in a specifiec period of time, so you can go through them . Download this report, and use the Moodle User upload way to remove those you want. Gem

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Laurie,

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Cloud Authenticated Users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I recently opened a Moodle Cloud account which has a limited number of users.Â  It states "a user is anyone who has a login to your site".Â  To me, this means an authenticated user.Â  I can clearly see how to unenroll a student from a course.Â  But how do I remove an authenticated user from my site?Â  I do not want to go over the limit and I do not see how to do this. p.s. I did search and cannot find the answer to this question. Nancy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Cloud Authenticated Users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Nancy, If you go to Site administration > Users > Accounts > Browse list of users, you'll find a delete link (bin icon) next to each user.

ResponsesInList.Title: User Authentication
ResponsesInList.Text: I recently signed up for a Moodle Cloud account with only 50 users.Â  I manually add these students to my site and then enroll them in my course.Â  I can clearly see how to remove them from my course.Â  However, I cannot figure out how to remove them from my site (remove authenticated users).Â  I want to be sure to keep my site users to less than 50 so may need to be able to delete some.Â  How do you do that?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Authentication
ResponsesInList.Text: Log in as administrator and click Site administration (on the left) and then Users > Browse list of users. Next to each user on the right you will see a delete icon. Click that delete icon (bin/trashcan) to remove them.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Authentication
ResponsesInList.Text: Oh I see, I was doing that, but doing it within the course. That worked when you do it without enter the course. Thanks so much.

ResponsesInList.Title: Migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, can someone advise if we can migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS (local machine)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Someone else may know better than I know, but I don't think what you seek is allowed by MoodleCloud. It's not a fault of MoodleCloud, either. Many systems that use shared databases don't allow users to do this. (However, I might be wrong.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS
ResponsesInList.Text: It would be possible to backup and download each course, then restore to your other site.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Trivnesh has a parallel post in this other topic .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Trivnesh, There are a few ways to do this. As explained by Marcus, you could follow the course backup/restore route. I would recommend to use this method if your MoodleCloud site has only few courses and not too many custom settings and users. You can also Export your MoodleCloud site , which will give you a zip file, which can be used to set up a Moodle site on another server . While this method will give you everything at once (courses, files, users, settings, etc.), it will require you know how to import a (possibly large) sql file into your server and move the files to the correct dataroot folder manually. Mathieu

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks everyone, really appreciate the help and support.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Ah, Mathieu, I didn't know about this "export your MoodleCloud site" feature. Cool. Someone was really thinking ahead. I am going to try this and see if I can restore this in my local MAMP Moodle. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Yep, I tried this Export your MoodleCloud feature and it works. However, the logstore table is empty, probably as expected because MoodleCloud probably doesn't keep all these entries. Â So, Trivnesh, follow Mathieu's advice.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you very much Rick and Mathieu.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Plagiarism detection in Moodlecloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mathieu, I would like to endorse Sam's request. Plagiarism detection becomes a necessity. We are simply requested to do it. I use a local installation of Moodle for my 'local' Uni teaching and Moodle Cloud for remote courses. Our local Uni Moodle uses TurnitIn, and I absolutely need a similar feature in Moodle Cloud (anything is better than nothing!). From the options you have mentioned, I know only TurnitIn. And I don't like it at all. At least the version we use - a separate activity - has no way to incorporate extensions (like user/group overrides), it does not accept Html files, there is no cutoff date, there is no marking workflow, there is no offline marking option, no marking groups, etc. A nightmare to use for larger classes. Would any of these plugins work that way? Thanks, Marcin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodlecloud trial period not supporting plugin installation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello there. When you say you are not able to add H5P content to your trial MoodleCloud site, how are you trying to do this? I wasn't able to find anything on this online.

ResponsesInList.Text: No one got back to you yet? We have the same question about annual users or concurrent users as our students are in and out not staying. Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Limits Moodle Cloud Plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stefanie, Suspended users to count towards quota. If you're at your user quota limit you'll have to delete some existing users to make room for more (or upgrade to a larger plan). Cheers, Cam

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Limits Moodle Cloud Plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all - according to moodle FAQs suspended users don't count towards your user quota see: https://moodle.com/faq/why-cant-i-add-more-users/ That being said - when I suspended some users the number of users indicated for my account did not change. I've logged this with moodle cloud support and will post an update once I have an answer.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Limits Moodle Cloud Plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Michelle, We have set a limit of users for each MoodleCloud plan. In our new 'MoodleCloud plans' (these are plans purchased or upgraded after November 200 and have a xxx.moodlecloud.com URL ) you are able to suspend users so they donâ€™t count towards your quota, but youâ€™ll still have their data and will be able to run reports on what theyâ€™ve previously completed. The suspend user feature has always been there but it's on the new plans we have been able to change the way the user count works to not count suspended users towards the user limit. This means that suspended users will still count towards your user quota if you are on a Moodle for School plan or a lone of our older MoodleCloud Plans . If you are unsure what plan you are on, you can find out in your MoodleCloud Portal. You are welcome to upgrade to our new Plans at any time, so that you can access this feature from your Portal. We have updated the FAQ to reflect this information. If you do choose to move from a Moodle for School plan to one of our new MoodleCloud plans, please note that the following features are no longer available: School theme & school domain (sitename.moodle.school) MoodleCloud theme Group Choice Activity Level up! Quizventure However you continue to have access to xxx.moodle.school (it will just redirect to xxx.moodlecloud.com). I hope that this helps. Kelly

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Limits Moodle Cloud Plans
ResponsesInList.Text: How exactly do you enforce quotas?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Limits Moodle Cloud Plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Bonjour Marc, The two quotas that are enforced on MoodleCloud are * file storage: file upload are limited to files that do not bring the site above it's allocated storage limit; * user accounts: once you reach the quota allocated to your plan, user creation features will be disabled (whether from creating a new account directly or bulk importing new users) In both cases, the system sends notification emails to the site owner, when the site gets close to those limits. Mathieu

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Limits Moodle Cloud Plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Bonjour Mathieu, Thank you for your quick reply. I'm very interested in knowing technically how you are enforcing quotas, as this has been a pain to manage on our own servers. Anybody we could contact in the community who could point us in the right direction?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Limits Moodle Cloud Plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Users on MoodleCloud sites are anyone who has a login to your site, this includes Site Administrators, Managers, Teachers and Students. So they are current users (concurrent users) have access. We got our answers.

ResponsesInList.Title: Design of MoodleCloud  Grades 7-12 multi-course site, so files are archived in .mbz
ResponsesInList.Text: Our MoodleCloud site is where teachers will jointly develop multi-grade, multi-subject courses with collaborative activities . There are many files and videos. Â These files will be shared across courses. Â  Â Then these courses will be archived with .mbz for distribution to rural schools on a SD card, Â for use on a Raspberry Pi running Moodle and Nextcloud in Internet in a Box. How should I set up file management? Â Â There are so many choices- what would you recommend? Â I would be willing to Â hire someone to get this done.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Design of MoodleCloud  Grades 7-12 multi-course site, so files are archived in .mbz
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi You know that by design the Moodle's internal repositories https://docs.moodle.org/en/Repositories "share" files? Moodle stores only unique files in moodledata/filedir/. "Files" in different courses are just links. Yes, I know the problem. Course backups need to have the files. So if the same file was linked from two courses, their backups get a copy of that file each. IsÂ  this the thing you want to avoid? Then the easiest solution is not to transfer course-wise, rather transfer the whole site. See https://docs.moodle.org/en/Site_backup and https://docs.moodle.org/en/Site_restore - if it is a possibility. Otherwise upload the files to an external repository and put only links in your courses. Since you mentioned remote areas, fetching these files through Internet every time is not a possibility, I believe. I would go for a File system repository https://docs.moodle.org/en/File_system_repository . But then Moodle Cloud won't allow that. Why don't you develop you courses in a R Pi itself, then duplicate the site. You can either copy the SD cards and send them to the sites, or make an ISO file, send it to the sites so that the local staff (re)write their SD cards.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Design of MoodleCloud  Grades 7-12 multi-course site, so files are archived in .mbz
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you so much. The goal is to use the Cloud site for collaborative development of Khmer documents., which can be download in a .mbz file in a sustainable, automated process. Due to limited resources, the R Pi's are used for more than Moodle, so Internet in a Box is a better platform, ex to allow use of the GPIO pins. Option 1) "Course backups need to have the files. So if the same file was linked from two courses, their backups get a copy of that file each" Given that teachers in different courses in the same subject, ex Physics, are uploading files, where should the shared Physics repository be? Where should the Repository be for a Moodle system-wide respiratory that provides the files to all courses? In these cases all teacher-limiited file access permissions would be disabled. Option 2) "Otherwise upload the files to an external repository and put only links in your courses. Since you mentioned remote areas, fetching these files through Internet every time is not a possibility, I believe." I want to meet the needs of rural schools where wifi is not available. If wifi is available, teachers and students can use the Moodle app and the Moodle Cloud version. I want a design that accommodates both user groups, and where remote locations will not need to download files. I believe the Pi issue is designating in Moodle the file path for external file access. The Moodle Cloud archived .mbz has a repository file path,. The Rapsberry Pi Moodle config files for all courses would need a local path. As much as possible, I want an automated process. Is a single large repository for grades K-12 Khmer files the best solution? If so I could download all the Cloud repository files to the Pi Moodle's default system-wide respository, prior to delivering the SD cards to rural schools. In the "Internet in a Box' world, teachers then use the USB stick to add local files. ** The disadvantage is every school gets a 128 GB SD card, which is expensive. Option 3) "Why don't you develop you courses in a R Pi itself, then duplicate the site. You can either copy the SD cards and send them to the sites, or make an ISO file, send it to the sites so that the local staff (re)write their SD cards." I have done this, but to make this sustainable, I want teachers to collaborate, share content, and get training in Moodle Cloud. Â Therefore the file repository issue remains. I need to either use the Moodle Cloud version as the primary version, or merge, on the development Pi box, the Moodle Cloud updated .mbz and external or internal repository files. Is the most automatible process, which allows teachers some autonomy, the Moodle Cloud as the primary source? Thank you for your thoughtful consideration of this issue. I have now purchased and am building a version of Moodle on Bluehost, so that I can now install any plugin, and have complete control of the filesystem. Your response could also move to this platform, if Moodle Cloud is too restrictive.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Design of MoodleCloud  Grades 7-12 multi-course site, so files are archived in .mbz
ResponsesInList.Text: You're welcome! After your explanations the case is clearer to me: Presently you have a Moodle instance on the Internet where the teachers develop courses. You pull those courses as course backups and push them through course restore in to Moodle instances which are not connected to the Internet. You are happy with the process except for one thing: Shared files in the original site appear in multiple course backups, bloating the volume of data to transfer. Correct? Then, that is the price you pay for the convenience. If you want to transfer each file only once, you have to do the transfer site-wise - through site backup and site restore . You need to study the process first. Generally speaking, there is no mechanism to "sync" Moodle instances in the sense that you merge (only) the changes in one site in to the other. The site backup and restore process mentioned above overwrites the target site! This is not what most people want, but in your case it might be OK - you are doing exactly that course-wise, I understand. If so, the solution (site backup > site restore) is simple. If you want something sophisticated, the places to look are: a) Moodle partners, who are also the main Moodle developers. You meet them in the General developer forum b) Freelancers, in the General help forum , for example. Both parties give free advice in various forums on moodle.org. If you are looking for a paid consultant, either contact a Moodle Partner directly or make an announcement on Moodle jobs pin board.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Design of MoodleCloud  Grades 7-12 multi-course site, so files are archived in .mbz
ResponsesInList.Text: Another place to look for help, which I forgot to mention in my previous post (but mentioned in my first reply) is the MoodleBox community. Although you are not using MoodleBox, your broader application has very much in common with MoodleBox, that of transporting the LMS on R Pi to areas where there is no Internet access. Scan similar discussions in their forum https://discuss.moodlebox.net/ . You'll meet a small, active community there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 3.11 Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, My site has recently been updated to 3.11, and the new changes for Student Activity Completion has been deployed. Is there a way that we can disable or hide the labels e.g. "To do: View" ? Or do we need to go into the css to change things? Student Activity Completion is a good feature, but the UI implementation is quite unsightly, as it adds quite a bit of space for each activity, and it takes a lot of scrolls to look through each activity in the course. Better design would have given it a better UX

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.11 Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: If you want to keep activity completion on but hide it on the course page, then click the cog icon Edit settings top right of your course and scroll down to Completion tracking - and change completion conditions to No. That way they won't be shown on the course page (but will still be shown when students click into an activity so they do know what they are supposed to do to complete it.) See Using Activity completion for more information.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.11 Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Mary, that worked

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.11 Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mary, Can you please tell me how to turn this off within an activity as well. From the video on student activity completion in moodle 3 11 ( ) it appears that it is now compulsory that it is there for the activity - if there is completion tracking. We have lesson activities that require students to watch videos and answer questions correctly to receive a certificate at the end of the lesson. An example of the 'To do' that is showing for one of these is: To do: Spend at least 55 mins on this activity To do: Receive a grade As you can imagine this is pretty pointless for our students and it also encourages them to just 'spend time' in the activity as opposed to watching all the videos and answering all the questions correctly. These requirements are made clear on the first screen of the lesson. As far as I am aware (and I do bumble along a bit), there is no way to force students to watch a video - other than setting a time limit for the activity. I'm really hoping that we are not forced to have the 'To do:' showing for every activity. Looking forward to a solution for this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.11 Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: I just realised I should add that we are hosted on MoodleCloud Regards Michelle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.11 Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Michelle, Have you considered using H5P for your videos? The content type Interactive Video? This allows users to add multiple choice and fill in the blank questions, pop-up text and other types of interactions to their videos using only a web browse. Have a look at the demo here: https://h5p.org/interactive-video If you wish to just turn off completion tracking for just an Activity - Go to Activity Actions Menu Edit Settings Scroll down to Activity Completion Change to 'Do not indicate activity completion' Click Save and display (that Activity will no longer display in the Edit course completion settings - Condition: Activity completion). I hope that this helps. Cheers Kelly

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.11 Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Kelly, Thanks for trying but unfortunately it doesn't help. I've been playing around with H5P already, but the lesson format has been set for 40+ courses and it was all working perfectly prior to the update to MoodleCloud last Friday. We have students in cohorts that are already working in these courses - to change content is not possible. For students to receive a certificate of completion they have to have 100% for the questions and they have to have spent the required amount of time in the activity. If I do not indicate activity completion then I can no longer have these restrictions for the issue of certificates. As mentioned previously - the time indicator is behind the scenes - they are told they have to watch all videos. We don't want them to focus on time in the lesson but on tasks. Is it really that the 'To do:...' is compulsory if you have any Activity Completion requirements set? I'm surprised that it seems to be all or nothing. Is there no way around this? Regards Michelle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.11 Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: You mean that you want them to spend (eg 55 minutes ) on the video but you don't want them to actually know that they have to spend 55 minutes on the videos? Before the 3.11 upgrade, did you use the "Time required" activity completion condition in your Lesson activities? Is it not an option to simply remove that required time completion condition?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.11 Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mary, It is not an option to remove the required time completion. We put the time restriction on because people were skipping the video and completing the lesson in 5 minutes by jumping to the question pages of the lesson. As far as I'm aware I can't put a time restriction on a content page in a lesson to prevent them moving on to the questions. I know I could use H5P to control the watching of the video but the content has already been created and the students are already working on the lessons. To further add to this issue - it's not just the time being mentioned that's the issue. The option in the lesson is to say that a grade is required and I can also set the pass grade and then in the certificate activity I get to set the requirement that it be a pass grade. To display the 'to do' as a grade being required is misleading. I have already had students calling about it. Yours and Kelly's answers and your video about this new feature, all indicate that it is now an all or nothing situation. Can you please confirm that the this new feature cannot be hidden from the activity if there are completion requirements set? Can you also confirm that the wording of these 'to do' statements cannot be adjusted (e.g. the 'receive a grade'). If my understanding is correct and I now have no choice but to display the preset 'to do' if I have completion requirements on activities, then is there any way that moodle users could be surveyed so that if others would like this to be an optional feature it could be adjusted in the 4.0 release? Alternatively, if the issue with it being compulsory is because we are a hosted MoodleCloud user and if I moved to a private host it could be turned off, please let me know. Kind regards Michelle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.11 Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Michelle. Here are a few pointers: It's not possible with the new 3.11 activity completion to hide it completely but still have it activated - it will always show within the activity even if it doesn't show on the course page. There is a long discussion on this subject in another forum here, which might interest you: How to use checkbox as student activity completion? (However, some of the suggestions won't work on a MoodleCloud site, for example using different plugins. Equally the wording of the 'to do' statements can be changed on non-MoodleCloud sites via Site administration >Language customisation) I very much recommend staying with MoodleCloud because of the reliablity of the service, but making your voice heard/opinion felt by, for example, voting in favour of supporting the pre-3.11 activity completion method in this tracker ticket : MDL-71856 and also joining the discussions on Moodle 4.0 features (where I believe improvement to activity completion will be made) in the User experience community .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.11 Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mary,

ResponsesInList.Title: File storage in Moodlecloud
ResponsesInList.Text: I have an account at Moodlecloud. I have deleted a number of users, but I see that their assignments seem to stay in the site, consuming a lot of useless space. Any idea/suggestion about this issue? Thanks! Enrique

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: File storage in Moodlecloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Enrique, You will need to delete the files from every location that they are located in. If it is assignment files you are trying to delete, unfortunately you cannot leave an assignment submission with no file after one has been submitted. This is a known problem in Moodle with a very long history in our issue tracker. There are a few ways you can work around this: Wait until your course has finished, export the grades if you need to save them and then reset the course - this removes all data that was in the course (including files). OR In the file picker, remove the PDF and upload a small dummy file (empty text file will do) and then save that as the students submission. An empty text file should only be a few bytes in size compared to the several megabyte PDF. I know this isn't ideal, but this assignment submission file handling comes from Moodle itself and is not specific to the MoodleCloud environment. Please note that, the cron clear up runs daily so these deleted documents may appear to be still there but if you leave it and don't check on it for a day or so, they will be deleted. If you continue to check on the files, it creates drafts and prolongs the deletion of the files. I hope that this helps. Warm regards, Kelly

ResponsesInList.Title: Notification Emails are not being sent
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I am on a moodlecloud plan, and students are not receiving notification emails when 1. I post on any forum, students are on "Forced Subscription" 2. When assignments are graded In fact, students do not receive any emails at all. I have checked default notification settings, and it is set to permitted with "online" and "offline" both ticked. Any advice? Thanks,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Notification Emails are not being sent
ResponsesInList.Text: Depending on what type of notification you need to send in Moodle, you can learn all about how Moodle sends notifications for different activities in our documentation: Forum activity Another option to set up notifications is to use the event monitoring rule. As a course teacher, go to Course administration > Reports > Event monitoring rules, or as an admin go to Site administration > Reports > Event monitoring rules. Event Monitoring If you are trying to send notifications on enrolment, please note that you are only able to do this on self enrolment method and you are unable to edit this email. You can however step up notifications of enrolment expirations. Please note that notifications do not go out for at least 30 minutes in Moodle, but even after that, it does depend on when your cron runs for your site. You can view the setting here: Site administration > Security > Site security settings > Maximum time to edit posts. Which reduces that 30 minute wait time, but ultimately it still depends on when cron runs for your site and if you have a MoodleCloud site, this is run by us here at Moodle HQ. You can find the details of when the cron last ran for your MoodleCloud site on the System status page:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Notification Emails are not being sent
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Kelly, that worked

ResponsesInList.Text: Hello there. I am just going to move your post to the MoodleCloud forum where you will get help from the Cloud team. However, I understand that the recyle bin is not enabled in MoodleCloud sites - if something says "defined in config.php" then it means that it is disabled.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: No recycle bin
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for that Mary. Just confirming - MoodleCloud is designed with an optimal User Experience in mind, so, in order to make it simpler to use, we have disabled some features and options that may be available in a self-hosted Moodle install. For configuration settings, if a setting has the label "Defined in config.php" next to it, then it is unable to be changed. It will look similar to this example: Because the recycle bin is disabled we recommend regular course backups, and you can setup automated course backups. To create a backup visit each individual course and click on Settings, then Backup. Whilst you won't be able to recover this file I hope this helps with future files.

ResponsesInList.Title: Delete backup files
ResponsesInList.Text:
A few months ago I backed up a couple of
courses and downloaded the backup files for storage off Moodle. Then I made
sure backup was disabled. Now it's time to delete the unneeded backup files
from Moodle storage. A forum post said to use this process: 1. Log in as admin 2. Go to the course 3. Click gear > Restore 4. Click Manage backup files 5. Click the File Picker icon (the little sheet of
paper) 6. Click the link of the file to be deleted 7. Click Select this file 8. Click the link of the file to be deleted again,
under the Files folder 9. Click the Delete button (here is where you also
have the option to download it before you delete it) 10. Click OK 11. Click Save Change
