ResponsesInList.Title: MoodleCloud storage
ResponsesInList.Text: We currently use the self-hosted version of Moodle on our server but are considering moving onto the MoodleCloud platform. How do I determine how much storage space I will need on MoodleCloud based on the current size of my Moodle installation? Is there a place on my installation that can tell me what size it currently is?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud storage
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Yvonne, There's not an easy way to see how "big" your moodle site is. I can give you the SQL query we use to calculate disk quota: SELECT SUM(f.filesize)
FROM (
SELECT DISTINCT
contenthash,
filesize
FROM mdl_files
WHERE filearea <> 'draft' AND
referencefileid IS NULL AND
component <> 'tool_recyclebin' AND
(component <> 'backup' OR mimetype <> 'application/vnd.moodle.backup') AND
component <> 'assignfeedback_editpdf' AND
component <> 'core_h5p' AND
component <> 'contentbank'
UNION SELECT contenthash, filesize from mdl_files WHERE (component = 'core_h5p' AND filearea = 'content'>
GROUP BY filesize, contenthash
) AS f"); This should return the number of bytes used by your site. Divide it by 1073741824 to get the value in gigabytes. Cheers, Cam

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud storage
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Cam, I appreciate your assistance, however running an SQL query is beyond my knowledge and comfort zone. We don't currently have a qualified administrator for our installation which is why we are wanting to move to the cloud. I was hoping there was a way to see the size in the Moodle admin or even in the directory as I have access and can use FTP to access the files.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud storage
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Yvonne, Since you have FTP access I've written a small PHP script to query the DB for you: <?php require_once('config.php'); global $DB; $bytes = $DB->get_field_sql(" SELECT SUM(f.filesize) FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT contenthash, filesize FROM {files} WHERE filearea <> 'draft' AND referencefileid IS NULL AND component <> 'tool_recyclebin' AND (component <> 'backup' OR mimetype <> 'application/vnd.moodle.backup') AND component <> 'assignfeedback_editpdf' AND component <> 'core_h5p' AND component <> 'contentbank' UNION SELECT contenthash, filesize from {files} WHERE (component = 'core_h5p' AND filearea = 'content' AND filesize > 0) GROUP BY filesize, contenthash ) AS f"); $index = floor(log($bytes, 1024)); echo round($bytes/1024**$index, 2) . ' ' . ['B', 'KB', 'MB', 'GB'][$index]; Save that in a file called "size.php" and upload it to the root of your moodle installation. Then browse to http://yourselfhostedmoodle.com/size.php It should tell you how "big" MoodleCloud considers your site. Cheers, Cam

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud storage
ResponsesInList.Text: If you store your course files on another network, you can see the storage size there, and it would be roughly equivalent... except SCORM files. Double the size of every SCORM package, because Moodle unzips your SCORM package, but also saves the ZIP. So a 10 MB SCORM course will use 20 MB of Moodle file storage.

ResponsesInList.Text: Bronwyn - have you enabled Email-based self-registration as well as Self enrolment ? This will allow people to create accounts in your site and then enrol themselves into courses. There isn't a way for them to be automatically enrolled into courses once they have logged into your MoodleCloud site. They have to have emails to be able to use Moodle. (There is a way to use fake emails but it is not recommended) If you'd like to discuss the Language issues, please start a new discussion and we can take it from there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodlecloud theme change
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Bronwyn, Boost provides a few basic options for changing colours, as you discovered. If this is not enough, the custom SCSS fields will allow you to use CSS and SCSS to change the colour of anything on the site. They can be found by navigating to "Site administration" > "Appearance" > "Themes" > "Boost", under the advanced tab. Please be aware that it's possible to render the site unusable by putting malformed SCSS/CSS in these fields. If you're not confident about it I would recommend doing some research, or looking for a freelancer to help you with the customisations. Your logo is way too big, There's no "ideal" size, but it should be something like 100x75 pixels. Please refer to the documentation on email based self registration - if you're still having trouble then please lodge a support request through your portal, including as much detail us possible for us to reproduce the issue. Regarding translations, do you want translations for content you have written yourself? There is no automated way to do that, however Moodle has the multilang filter which allows you to provide translations for your content. Hope this helps. Cheers, Cam

ResponsesInList.Title: Restoring course that has just been deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: I was devastated to receive an email on December 17 saying that our course ( https://mds.moodlecloud.com/course/view.php?id=3 ) has been deleted. We spent about two years developing that course for our international students. The email read that "this is a courtesy email to inform you that your site mds.moodlecloud.com has been deleted from MoodleCloud." We have students who are expected to come from many different countries to take the course this spring and we cannot possibly replace this material in time. I read that you are able to restore courses within 14 days. I would be so grateful if you could do that. I understand that restoring this course is performed by the technical team, so I will gladly pay the fee for this service immediately. I apologize for my negligence in not being aware of the frequency with which I need to log in. I promise it won't happen again.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restoring course that has just been deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Robert, Sorry to hear you have lost your MoodleCloud site. Under our free site retention policy, if your Moodle for Free site has been inactive for more than 14 days, it is removed in order to maintain a vibrant and active system for all users. We do send a reminder email message before the site is removed. To get the site back online, we are able to restore your site data but as this is performed by our technical team there is a fee of $100.00 AUD. Also, please note that to comply with our GDPR policies, as you are no longer as a customer, you will need to reply to this email for us to go ahead with the site restore within 14 days of the site deletion date or your site will be deleted from our systems. Your other option is to recreate your site. You can do this in the MoodleCloud Portal or by completing the signup. Unfortunately, the content of the site has been deleted. To ensure it does not get removed in the future you need to make sure it is accessed regularly or you can choose to upgrade your site to a Starter or Moodle for School plan where the inactive policy does not apply. I shall send you a PayPal invoice to the registered address and if you do decide to go ahead with the site restore then we will action this restore for you. If you have any further questions, please let me know or visit our FAQ page. Also, it's worth a gentle reminder that in order to retain your restored site you will need to login every 14 days. With that in mind, we recommend that you upgrade to a Paid Subscription (starting from $80 depending on which Plan you select). With a Paid Subscription there is no regular requirement to log in every 14 days.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restoring course that has just been deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you so much, Craig. I am very happy to let you know that Support has already helped me with this issue. (I was desperate to get the course restored and didn't know whether to contact Support or MoodleCloud forum. And, I didn't want the 14 days to lapse.) When my supervisor returns from holiday break, I will strongly encourage her to push for the school to upgrade to a paid subscription. Since I inherited this course fairly recently, I didn't know much about Moodle, but now that I have read more over the weekend, I can tell you that I'm really impressed with your mission and vision. Also, a colleague recently conducted a training session to other instructors to demonstrate how useful Moodle has been to our international students in this course. Again, thank you for your prompt reply. To say that I am relieved would be an understatement.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bigbluebutton recording access in MoodleCloud site
ResponsesInList.Text: â€‹Hi Thurein, All our MoodleCloud sites include BigBlueButton, a video conferencing tool designed especially for education. Your BigBlueButton recordings are kept for 7 days on a free Trial account, and 365 days on any paid plan. You can have up to 100 students in a BigBlueButton conference, and up to 8 in each breakout room. See https://bigbluebutton.org/teachers/ for details of how BigBlueButton can be used to connect teachers and students in real time. Visit the BigBlueButton community pages for support: https://bigbluebutton.org/support/community/ For more information on the Moodle BigBlueButton plugin go to https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_bigbluebuttonbn If you need recordings to be downloaded you can either use software like Zoom Meetings, or you can move to a self-hosted installation or Moodle Partner hosting, where the BigBlueButton sessions can be downloaded. I hope this helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple external tools using moodle cloud

ResponsesInList.Title: Forum not sending messages
ResponsesInList.Text: It's now more than 5 hours since I put some post in two different forums, and they have not been sent. My experience is that the time elapsed since you put a post and it is sent varies enormously. But frequently it takes 2-3 hours. Do you experienceÂ  a similar problem? What can we do ? I understand that in Moodlecloud could you cannot run manually cronjob. Any idea/suggestion would be welcome. Regards. Enrique

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Forum not sending messages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Enrique. Due to the nature of MoodleCloud, we cannot continuously run cron jobs for sites. Instead we run cron for small batches of sites. We try to prioritise active sites when processing batches (this is based on the last time someone logged in to the site). It isn't unusual for there to be a delays of several hours between a particular site's cron run. Cheers, Cam

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Forum not sending messages
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Cameron for your reply. Some times 6 hours have elapsed before a post was sent to the students. I have found thatÂ  I have to use the option of sending without waiting time for editing. The the posts are sent in 20-30 minutes. I suggest that you consider introducing some change to correct this. Kind regards. Enrique

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Forum not sending messages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Enrique, If you believe this is a bug or problem in Moodle, feel free to report it on the issue tracker under the MDL project. Cheers, Cam

ResponsesInList.Title: MoodleCloud's HTML5 Player and "Hidden from Vimeo" video iFrame
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, So I've encountered a bit of an issue while using some of the additional security features on Vimeo and the HTML5 embedding feature on a "Page" source. I'm wondering if anyone here can help with info on the matter. On Vimeo I have my videos uploaded as a "Hidden from Vimeo" video and the privacy setting to only allow for the videos to be embedded on approved domains. The only approved domain I have listed are my moodle pages "_____. MoodleCloud .com". After copying and pasting the embed code from the Vimeo video into the Moodle "Page" source under HTML5 I get a notification from the Vimeo player "Sorry Because of its privacy settings, this video cannot be played here." I checked Vimeos information boards and found this: "If youâ€™re seeing this error in the player, the video you are watching has domain -level privacyÂ enabled. The videoâ€™s owner can adjust the domains where a video can appear within â€œWhere can this video be embedded?â€ section of the embed settings page. If the domain is listed in your video settings page, but the error is still appearing, the domain specified in your address bar may be different from the domain sent to the Vimeo player. In these cases, the privacy error may appear. Contact a web developer to confirm if there is anything in your site's HTML code that could be blocking the referrer from reaching our player iframe." Is the HTML player reporting a different domain back to Vimeo? I am using a trial version of moodle to evaluate Moodles efficacy for the task. Will this issue persist after I move from the trial version to the paid version of Moodle? Is there a way to have my site report the proper URL back to Vimeo to reach the player iframe? Thanks in advance for any insight, Josh P.S. I'm new to the forum so if I posted in the wrong thread let me know and I will remediate the issue.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud's HTML5 Player and "Hidden from Vimeo" video iFrame
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Josh, I know this post was posted a while ago, but I will do my best to offer support. We have worked with Vimeo in our organisation for the exact reason, having domain control. The platform is very effective in this way. From the information supplied it seems you are listing a domain that is not specific, so you are telling Vimeo it can accept any subdomain, but Vimeo does not work in this way, you need to list the exact website URL . In our experience this worked the best.

ResponsesInList.Title: Billing - MoodleCloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Good Afternoon, I was hoping someone would be able to direct me to where I can find a copy of my Moodle invoice? I have searched everywhere in my profile with no luck! Thank You. Greg

ResponsesInList.Title: Ang: Billing
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle is free. If you are paying, then you are most likely paying for hosting and support. Doesn't the payment state who the payment is to? That is where you should look.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ang: Billing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Greg, I am assuming you have a MoodleCloud site and am going to move your post to the MoodleCloud forum...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ang: Billing - MoodleCloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, If it's a MoodleCloud site - then you can find your MoodleCloud invoice/receipt in your MoodleCloud Portal. The MoodleCloud Portal is where you manage your MoodleCloud account, billing details and access statistics on the usage of your site. To access your MoodleCloud Portal: From within your MoodleCloud site (as the Site Administrator), click on "Portal" icon on the mid right hand side of your site. OR Copy this URL and ensure that sitename is replaced with yours: https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/portal/view/sitename To login to the MoodleCloud Portal: Enter your Site Name and your MoodleCloud password (which is the same as the admin password for your MoodleCloud site). Once you are inside of your Portal, you can access your invoice by clicking on the "Billing" tab. You can then download your invoice by clicking on the download icon. I hope this information helps. Kelly

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ang: Billing
ResponsesInList.Text: Kelly, Thank you so much for this - was able to find it! Really, really appreciate it. -greg

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ang: Billing - MoodleCloud
ResponsesInList.Text: What are the payment methods?Â  American Express, Visa, Mastercard and Paypal? I was asking specifically if I would be able to pay the billing invoice via American Express? I appreciate your assistance in answering. Thank you, Phyllis

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ang: Billing - MoodleCloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Phyllis, MoodleCloud's payment processor accepts Visa, Mastercard and Paypal (not American Express sorry). I hope this helps. Happy Moodling! Kelly

ResponsesInList.Title: Terms of Service Questions - Help!
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello! I was a Moodle Admin for over 10 years at a previous university and am now trying to use MoodleCloud at my new university. I just need it for a couple of chemistry classes (for the quiz engine), and I plan to publish the Moodle chem quizzes as LTI for use in Canvas. I can configure the system, train, document, create classes, etc, as I have in the past. I am just looking for a PaaS model. THE PROBLEM I can't get answers to a few Terms of Service questions that are not addressed in the MoodleCloud ToS doc. When our security team poses Terms of Service questions to Moodle support, they get the stock, "You need a Moodle Partner" answer. Why do I need a Moodle partner when I just need Terms of Service answers? Our UWM security team simply needs a few questions answered and our tool interoperability agreement signed before we can sign up and pay for MoodleCloud. The university won't move forward with the purchase without the Terms of Service answers. Is there really *nobody* at MoodleCloud who can answer us? Any advice?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Terms of Service Questions - Help!
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Katherine, Please accept our apologies for the delay in replying - it was a public holiday yesterday here in Western Australia (Moodle HQ) and hence no one was available to reply to you immediately, yesterday. You can see our company wide Privacy Page here: https://moodle.com/privacy-notice/ Site Access The only people that will have access to your site will be users that you have enrolled into your course, or users that you have given access to your MoodleCloud site (i.e. Site Admin, Manager, Teacher and so on). For MoodleCloud & App Specific information see below: MoodleCloud Privacy & Security Please see the links below for information on our privacy and security policies: https://moodlecloud.com/app/privacy and https://moodlecloud.com/app/terms Moodle App Security For further information about the Moodle App and itâ€™s own security you can read more here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Security MoodleCloud Data Processing Agreement Our Data Processing Agreement can be found here: https://moodlecloud.com/app/dpa/pdf MoodleCloud AWS Hosting Our data is hosted on AWS and you can read more about their security here: https://aws.amazon.com/security/ I hope that this helps. Warm regards, Kelly

ResponsesInList.Text: The problem is 2 fold I have added students, instructors, and administrators. When attempting to send the email out to the students they receive nothing. Plus on the home page, there is no listing of my course. I need to be able to see the course so I can send it to the students.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for assistance
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Darryl. Where are you sending the email from when you send it to students? Also, assuming their emails are correct, have they checked in their spam folders? Secondly, do you mean the course is not listed on your Dashboard ? If you want a course to be listed on the Dashboard then you as teacher need to be enrolled in it. As for sending it to the students, you could enrol them in the course and then when they log in they will see the course on their Dashboard as soon as they log in. Have you gone through the Moodle Admin Basics course? I do recommend it for your type of query.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for assistance
ResponsesInList.Text: i took the Moodle Admin Basic Course. I am still having the same problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for assistance
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Darryl Regarding the Moodle Admin Basics course, I would certainly recommend that you go through it thoroughly, digesting the material in the books and videos and doing the quizzes several times to get a high grade, as the course will definitely help, whether you want to get a badge/certificate or not. In the meantime, can you give more information regarding the other questions in my previous post? I can point you in the direction of the relevant links in that course or explain a bit more.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for assistance
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Darryl, Depending on what type of notification you need to send in Moodle, you can learn all about how Moodle sends notifications for different activities in our documentation: Managing a Moodle Course As a course teacher, go to Course administration > Reports > Event monitoring rules, or as an admin go to Site administration > Reports > Event monitoring rules. You can learn more about it below: Event Monitoring If you are trying to send notifications on enrolment, please note that you are only able to do this on self enrolment method and you are unable to edit this email. You can however step up notifications of enrolment expirations. You can learn more about below: Self enrolment: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Self_enrolment Manual enrolment: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Manual_enrolment Course enrolment: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Course_enrolment Please note that notifications do not go out for at least 30 minutes in Moodle, but even after that, it does depend on when your cron runs for your site.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate MoodleCloud site to another MoodleCloud site

ResponsesInList.Title: Upload users does not update country nor timezone
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello All, this is my first post so sorry for newbie errors. I use Moodle on MoodleCloud. I am trying to update country and timezone for all my students (they are at different location than me). I use Site administration/Users/Accounts/Upload users. My CSV file looks like this: username,firstname,lastname,email,idnumber,country,timezone id1,fname,lname,who@mail.edu.cn,872362336,CN,8 There are 68 users in the file. All the accounts have already been created before (with the same file, but without the country and timezone columns). I am attempting to only update. In the upload settings I have: Upload type - Update existing users only Existing user details - Override with file Existing user password - No changes Allow renames - No Allow deletes - No etc... After clicking 'Upload users' I am getting 0 errors, but the country and timezone remain unchanged. Does anybody know what I am doing wrong? Thanks, Marcin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload users does not update country nor timezone
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Marcin, Have you tried to purge all caches? You can easily do this as the site admin by going to Site Administration > Development > Purge all caches. Moodle can cache themes, language strings, filters and other bits of information that have been calculated and stored by the web browser. This link forces all user web browsers to refresh their screens of any information that Moodle has cached. Several modules that use cache have settings which will turn off caching for that module. Eliminating or purging caches slows performance. For more information, check out Purge all caches: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Developer_tools#Purge_all_caches You might also want to double check that all the fields in the CSV are valid. You can find more information here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Upload_users#User_Fields_that_can_be_included I hope that this helps and you are able to update. Kelly

ResponsesInList.Title: MoodleCloud Trial Platform
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, First of all, thanks in advance for help. We are triying MoodleCloud platform and we have an error triying to restore a backup file: "The file you tried to upload is too large for the server to process." But the system says we have Unlitimed file size, MAX 5G in total. The file we are triying to restore is 2GB size. (*.mbz) Anyone had this issue too? Thanks in advance for your help BR, S.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud Trial Platform
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi BR, The maximum upload limit for your MoodleCloud site is 100MB, this applies to all uploads including Restore files. If you have access to the Course that the Backup was created from you can go into the course, remove any large items (videos, pictures) and then recreate the Backup File and do a Course Restore again. You will then be able to upload them to the newly created Course. You visit each individual course and click on Settings, then Backup to create the Backup. You will need to go toÂ Â go to "Site Admin/Server Files" and find the automated backup there and download it to your computer. You then go to Site Admin / Courses / Restore Course to upload that file and Restore. You can learn more about backup and restore here: â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹ https://docs.moodle.org/en/Backup https://docs.moodle.org/en/Course_restore I hope that this helps. Warm regards,

ResponsesInList.Title: Add SpeechAce plugin to MoodleCloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi. I've recently purchased a MoodleCloud subscription. Upon purchase I was not aware that external plugins are not allowed on this site. As a pronunciation teacher I need a tool where my student can record themselves and the tool will automatically check for their pronunciation mistakes. SpeechAce does this quite well, however it is a plugin which cannot be installed on MoodleCloud. I wonder if there are any alternative ways I can do to achieve the same outcome (Let my students speak + Check their pronunciation) on MoodleCloud. If not, how can I install an external plugin on my site? (Even with extra cost) Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add SpeechAce plugin to MoodleCloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi David, We do explain on our website, that MoodleCloud sites have a number of selected plugins installed. To keep the platform simple and stable for all users we do not allow you to install your own plugins at this time. You might want to consider if H5P will do this for you. H5P is a plugin that is included for free in all our MoodleCloud sites. There is a list of all available content types here: https://h5p.org/content-types-and-applications I wonder if this particular one might do what you require: https://h5p.org/speak-the-words-set The plugin list will grow and continue to be updated. So if MoodleCloud currently does not support the particular plugin you are after, we will record your plugin request and other feedback to inform future work and additions to the system. If however, you require this plugin to be installed immediately for your MoodleCloud site, I can pass you onto your Moodle Partners to discuss your custom needs. Please note that if you want to have plugins added to your site, you will need to move to a Moodle site hosted by our Moodle Partners or a self-hosted site.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add SpeechAce plugin to MoodleCloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Kelly, Thank you for your response. If we transfer our site to one of your Moodle partners, is it possible to transfer our subscription as well? Or do we have to pay for it as well as the MoodleCloud site? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle on cloud cannot install plugin and theme.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, As explained on our website, MoodleCloud sites have a number of selected plugins installed. To keep the platform simple and stable for all users we do not allow you to install your own plugins at this time. Unfortunately not all plugins are installed. You can view the list of available plugins here: https://moodle.org/plugins/browse.php?list=set&id=80 The plugin list will grow and continue to be updated. So if MoodleCloud currently does not support the particular plugin you are after, we will record your plugin request and other feedback to inform future work and additions to the system. If however, you require this plugin to be installed immediately for your MoodleCloud site, I can pass you onto your Moodle Partners to discuss your custom needs. Please note that if you want to have plugins added to your site, you will need to move to a Moodle site hosted by our Moodle Partners or a self-hosted site. If you let us know what you were trying to achieve using a plugin, we may be able to suggest an alternative method of achieving the same outcome.

ResponsesInList.Title: MoodleCloud announce increased free quotas plus NGO and nonprofits program
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, We are committed to providing open source, free e-learning tools for educators. Thatâ€™s why all our software is free and open source, and this will never change. Hundreds of thousands of institutions have downloaded and are using Moodle on their own servers worldwide. MoodleCloud is one of our official hosting services that makes it simple for anyone to get a Moodle site without needing to install it on a local server .Â  Since 2015, MoodleCloud has provided a number of simple packages for smaller users, including a 50-user Free plan with 200Mb. Announcement 1: New free trial with larger quotas We are happy to announce the launch of a new MoodleCloud Free Trial with four times more users (200) and double the storage (400 MB). Everyone will be able to use their MoodleCloud Free Trial for 45 days before deciding to move to one of our inexpensive paid plans. Announcement 2: NGO and nonprofits program As part of our mission we are now offering our larger MoodleCloud plans completely free to registered NFPs and NGOs. All you need to do is apply here , and if accepted, we will give you a full-size MoodleCloud plan for no cost. Costs are subsidised by donations we've received. Does this replace the existing free plan? Yes! This new Free Trial upgrades and replaces our old Free plan (that expires if unused for 14 days). Will people keep their existing MoodleCloud free sites? Yes! Sites currently on the old Free plan will remain unchanged (so long as you use them at least once every 14 days!). Your support is welcome If you, or someone you know, would like to make a donation towards paying for deserving institutions to have free MoodleCloud sites, please visit moodle.com/donations . Thanks, and happy Moodling! Lee Goldsworthy Product Manager - MoodleCloud (Edited by Frances Le Page - original submission Wednesday, April 15, 2020, 3:06 PM) (Edited by Frances Le Page - original submission Wednesday, April 15, 2020, 3:06 PM) (Edited by Frances Le Page - original submission Wednesday, April 15, 2020, 3:06 PM)

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Cloud to VPS

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Cloud to VPS
ResponsesInList.Text: The MoodleCloud Portal is where you manage your MoodleCloud account, billing details, exports and access statistics on the usage of your site. To access your MoodleCloud Portal: From within your MoodleCloud site (as the Site Administrator), click on "Portal" icon on the mid right hand side of your site. OR Copy this URL and ensure that sitename is replaced with yours: https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/portal/view/sitename To login to the MoodleCloud Portal: Enter your Site Name and your MoodleCloud password (which is the same as the admin password for your MoodleCloud site). Once you are inside of your Portal, you can access Site Export by clicking on the "Tools" tab, selecting a database and clicking on 'Export this site'.

ResponsesInList.Title: Migrating everything to MoodleCloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi folks, I have a client still running Moodle 2.9, and I have advised him to migrate to MoodleCloud. Are the steps and options for such a migration documented anywhere? In addition to course material, he would like to migrate users and all associated data, and is quite worried about losing historical data. What will he be able to migrate, and what will he lose? Is any of this documented anywhere? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrating everything to MoodleCloud
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Anton, To migrate from a self hosted server to a MoodleCloud site, I would suggest taking backups of your courses and then restoring them into your MoodleCloud site. Be mindful that you have to select whether to include student data etc when you create the backup. If you don't select it then it won't be in the Backup. You visit each individual course and click on Settings, then Backup to create the Backup. You will need to go toÂ Â go to "Site Admin/Server Files" and find the automated backup there and download it to your computer. Once you have signed up for a MoodleCloud site then go to Site Admin / Courses/ Restore Course to upload that file and Restore. You can learn more here: https://docs.moodle.org/310/en/Upgrading All the best, Kelly

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Free hosting for minigroup?
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Debjani, You can sign up for a Free 45 Day Trial of MoodleCloud and Restore the courses that you have created to the Trial Site. You can sign up for our Free 45 Trial on our plan page here: https://moodle.com/moodlecloud/ You visit each individual course and click on Settings, then Backup to create the Backup. You will need to go to your "Site Admin/Server Files" and find the automated backup there and download it to your computer. Then go to your MoodleCloud Free Trial - go to Site Admin / Courses/ Restore Course to upload that file and Restore it. You can learn more about backup and restore here: â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹ https://docs.moodle.org/en/Backup https://docs.moodle.org/en/Course_restore I hope that helps. Kelly

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating a Second Moodle Site
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jessica, There's no automated way to keep two MoodleCloud sites synchronised. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Themes - will it ever be possible to allow course themes
ResponsesInList.Text: MoodleCloud is specific on this: MoodleCloud plans include the Moodle Standard Theme and the Boost Theme. Installing your own theme is not possible on MoodleCloud, however you are able to customise many aspects of the themes we have available. ResponsesInList.Title: Course Completion Question - from a newbie
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I am very new to Moodle having just created a MoodleCloud account to transfer a current classroom-based course to online. So far I have setup a test course with a number of activities and used a test user to see how that functions from the student's end.Â  The student's progress appears 100% (all boxes have green ticks). I have setup Course Completion so that all activities have to be completed. When I view the Course Completion report (Edit > More > Reports > Course Completion, the "Course Complete" box has a blue tick. A couple of questions. Should an automated email be sent to the student stating that they have completed the course? I can't see where to setup certificates?Â  If this can be done, how does this work from a student's end? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course Completion Question - from a newbie
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Richard and welcome to Moodle! Should an automated email be sent to the student stating that they have completed the course? No, course completion functionality doesn't include email notifications. For more details of how it works, please see the documentation Using Course completion . I can't see where to setup certificates? If this can be done, how does this work from a student's end? Assuming you're on a MoodleCloud plan which includes custom certificates, you should be able to set one up in your course by turning editing on, clicking 'Add an activity or resource' and selecting 'Custom certificate'.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course Completion Question - from a newbie
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Helen - both for the warm welcome and the advice provided. I have now setup a custom certificate (basic but gets my testing closer to completion) and added that as the final activity of my test course and have set it to email the student. However, my test student account can select the 'completion certificate' activity without having completed all the prior activities. Am I missing something obvious? Thanks again.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course Completion Question - from a newbie
ResponsesInList.Text: Have you set up Activity completion for all prior activities? You will then need to go into the certificate settings and set access restrictions for the prior activities. For more details, please see Restrict access .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course Completion Question - from a newbie
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Helen. I had originally set course competency but needed to tweak a couple of aspects. Now all correct. Thanks again.

ResponsesInList.Title: Increase MoodleCloud storage with external storage
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, would you please help me understand the basics of moodle storage: we're using a MoodleCloud instance offering 200 users and 400 MB storage space. As we have 195 users, with c. 150 being students, when they submit assignments to their teachers (which they upload to moodle as pdf/jpg files, this 400 MB is used up very quickly. Is there a way to use external storage space so that material submitted / uploaded by student goes there instead of using that precious 400MBs? Thank you very much Nikolas (Edited by Mary Cooch - original submission Tuesday, 17 November 2020, 8:28 PM)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: (possibly very stupid) storage question
ResponsesInList.Text: It's not a stupid question at all; it's a very good one In fact with MoodleCloud you are encouraged to do just what you suggest. Have your students store their work in external sites such as Google Drive, NextCloud or OneDrive and send you the link. Look at the question ""What does file storage mean?" in the page: https://moodle.com/moodlecloud/

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: (possibly very stupid) storage question
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for replying. We feel that younger students (ages 10 to 14) are not tech-savvy enough to manage/use dropbox/onedrive/etc links. Most of our students don't have these. And the building block in Moodle that allows students to submit their homework a nice drag-n-drop feature that accepts files, not links. 400MB (or even 1GB for the largest MoodleCloud offering) seems inexplicably low. Storage in hosting is very cheap these days, these offerings could / should offer 10 times the storage. Or, allow the connection to external storage.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: (possibly very stupid) storage question
ResponsesInList.Text: What kind of homeworks are your younger students doing? I mean what kind of assignments are they uploading as PDF or JPG? I am only asking because I used to be responsible for pupils aged between 7 and 10 and they used the online text assignment type which worked much better since mine were mainly adding text. If their assignments are text then they could type straight into Moodle and you could comment directly on their work.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: (possibly very stupid) storage question
ResponsesInList.Text: The way assignments are currently given out by teachers, submissions pretty much are in pdf or jpg, scanned/photographed pages off the students' copybook. This creates big files. Online test assignment sounds good (although I'm not sure how it would cover maths notation and Greek), nevertheless the solution we're looking for is an immediate and drastic one, a way to increase storage. Does MoodleCloud allow to use external storage to store data?

ResponsesInList.Title: Increase MoodleCloud storage with external storage
ResponsesInList.Text: You can do Maths notation and type in Greek using the online text type assignment. I am not sure what you mean by does MoodleCloud allow to use exernal storage to store data - that is what using Google drive, OneDrive etc is all about surely?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Increase MoodleCloud storage with external storage
ResponsesInList.Text: Google/OneDrive etc can be use for I would term 'outgoing data' or techer-to-student. No problem there. It's student-submitted files, or 'incoming data' that's the issue. MoodleCloud offers just 400MB or 1GB for this, it would be desirable (and technically possible) to link to an external storage service (AWS S3, OneDrive etc) and all submissions could be stored there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Is server needed for moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I would like to know if you have to rent a server when you haveÂ  LMS Moodle Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is server needed for moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: It requires a server to run. It can be run on your local machine but for anyone else to see it you will need a machine that your users can access.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is server needed for moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, Moodle is a client-server web application. Pl. read https://docs.moodle.org/en/About_Moodle .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is server needed for moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: But, if you pay for MoodleCloud, you don't need your own server. That is just one of various ways that you can pay someone else to look after the server for you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Orphaned files
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm using Moodlecloud, based on Moodle 3.8.1 (Build: 20200113). if I go into Site administration - Server - Files , I see many files that I thought shouldn't have been there. Specifically: 1) Files delivered by my students years ago, answering Assignments I asked them. The Assignments are still online, among the courses activities , but I deleted those student accounts years ago, so I thought that the files sent by those students were also automatically erased. Since it isn't so, I'm doing in this way: I duplicate each of those Assignment resources (Duplicate tool); and then I delete the original resource. In this way, those orphaned files disappear from the list and I can keep an empty copy of the original Assignments, if I want to use them in the future. However I think that this workaround is a little intricate, so I would ask you if there is a better one. 2) I found two copies of the same resource: Filename Size Type User Component Filearea Action TCP.pkt 1.58 MB application/octet-stream Luigi mod_resource content View in context TCP.pkt 83.58 KB application/octet-stream Luigi mod_resource content View in context If I click the View in context button I land in the same course. Well, the right file is the second one: I first uploaded in the course the 1.58 MB version of the file, then I replaced the file with the 83.58 KB version. Indeed, if I check all the course resources, I find only one occurrence of the TCP.pkt file, and this is the one whose size is 83.58 KB. So the larger version of the file (1.58 MB) shouldn't be in the list. WhatÂ  can I do to delete it? Thanks so much for reading and for your reply, Luigi

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Orphaned files
ResponsesInList.Text: Sorry It was my mistake: in that course I created two resources, each embedding a file called TCP.pkt (and the two files were different in size). So, it's (and already was) all right!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Access to class data

If you wanted to set up a notification email, I would suggest using Event monitoring: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Event_monitoring You may then be able to set up some automation to go with your site triggered by the emails in your Inbox? Without knowing more about your site it's hard to know what to suggest but there are services like Zapier and IFTTT that may work. Hope this helps!

But it is difficult to know which plugins come as standard with paid plans as not all standard plugins seem to installed enabled in the trial version. It's all a bit confusing! Can anyone advice which plugins come as standard with paid Cloud sites that are not included in the trial version? Many thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Cloud- Enrolment Course Completed enrolment plugin??
ResponsesInList.Text: Enrolment Course Completed is not included in MoodleCloud sites currently. As explained on our website, our MoodleCloud School sites (Mini, Small and Medium) have a number of selected plugins pre-installed. Check out what plugins are included in our MoodleCloud for School sites here: https://moodle.org/plugins/browse.php?list=set&id=80 (please note that this extra plugin pack is not currently available in the Free Trial or Starter Plan). You can read more about the inclusions here: https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/ To keep the platform simple and stable for all users we do not allow you to install your own plugins at this time, so if you require a particular plugin to be installed immediately for your MoodleCloud site, we can pass you onto your Moodle Partners to discuss your custom needs. Please note that if you want to have plugins added to your site, you will need to move to a Moodle site hosted by our Moodle Partners or a self-hosted site. Warm regards,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Cloud- Enrolment Course Completed enrolment plugin??

ResponsesInList.Title: Large Video File Upload to moodle but Uploaded to be changed audio File
ResponsesInList.Text: Large Video File Upload to moodle. but Uploaded to be changed audio File .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Large Video File Upload to moodle but Uploaded to be changed audio File
ResponsesInList.Text: Our MoodleCloud plans do have strict limits and our max file storage is defined as the maximum storage for your entire site. The individual file upload size of 100mb is across all plans. For this reason we suggest hosting files externally: You can host files on Dropbox, Google Drive, iCloud or other web sites, and then link to them in Moodle using a Resource URL . This link explains how you could host on OneDrive and use in your course: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/OneDrive_repository Dropbox: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Dropbox_repository Google Drive: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Google_Drive_repository Amazon S3: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Amazon_S3_repository Host your videos on Youtube. Any link to your videos will be automatically and seamlessly embedded in a course in your MoodleCloud site: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/YouTube_videos_repository Think about linking/embedding existing websites for your content instead of redeveloping it all from scratch. Use Page and Book Resources in Moodle instead of uploading PDFs. Keep the quota for individual users down to something low, to encourage small files.

ResponsesInList.Title: File Storage - deleting unwanted images
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm designing a course and I've uploaded about 15 image files, which have taken up 30 of my 200MBs. I'd like to delete them and reduce them before uploading them again. However, I can't work out how to delete unwanted images in order to free up more storage space. Can anybody help?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: File Storage - deleting unwanted images
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dylan, You will need to delete the files from every location that they are located in. If you are using Moodle For School Theme: Go into your Site Administration settings Go into your Server files (Site Administration > Server > Files), select a file you want to remove and click â€œView in context â€, this will take you to the course where the file is located. You could also go straight to the course where the file is located. Turn editing on in your course Click the edit arrow next to where the file is (if unknown, go into each section of the course to try and find where the file is located) select â€œedit settingsâ€.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodlecloud not sending SMS
ResponsesInList.Text: After receiving your log entry for the 2020-11-02T10:18:24.640Z Message has been accepted by phone event, I spent a little over an hour troubleshooting with my mobile service provider. They (Google Fi) helped me successfully switch MCC/MNC numbers on my mobile phone in case that could have been associated with my non-receipt of SMS messages from MoodleCloud. After switching, I tried again to set up a 45-day free Moodle server using MoodleCloud.com, and again I received no SMS. I imagine that your logs will show this attempt about 2 hours ago, but all records accessible to me and Google Fi indicate that my mobile number received no SMS messages during our troubleshooting session. So Google Fi tech support feels confident that the problem is not with my setup, but instead with your setup, but I imagine you've done testing with your setup which has probably led you to the conclusion that it is operating perfectly. Also, I've had no problem receiving other automated SMS verification messages from other services like banks and others that try to do a form of 2FA using SMS. This also tends to support the assertion that the root problem is with MoodleCloud, not with my service, but I'm sure there are many uncertainties that I'm not aware of too. However, I'm unclear on one particular issue. Although I'm no expert on the SMS Protocol, for many years I have had the impression that, like the User Datagram Protocol, the Simple Message Service Protocol provides no "message accepted by phone" feature. Your log entry gives me the opposite impression, but I don't understand Amazon SNS messages, so maybe the SNS Protocol expands upon the SMS Protocol? Can you elaborate on this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodlecloud not sending SMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Kevin, Do you have access to another mobile phone (perhaps friend or family) that you can use for this? Â Even better if you can try a phone that is not on the Google Fi network. Our system is sending the message from AWS, and after that delivery is with your phone provider, so we are unable to provide further assistance in that respect. Warm regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Change of Moodle Cloud Site Name
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings, I have a paid school Moodle Cloud site and want to change the site name. Is this possible and if so how do you do it? With Thanks Michael

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Change of Moodle Cloud Site Name
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Michael, It is possible to change the name of your MoodleCloud site once it has been created. This change is performed by our technical team and there is a fee of $50 AUD to go ahead with the site name change. You are only allowed to modify the first part of the URL - ncat.moodlecloud.com -- the domain must stay the same (moodle.school or moodlecloud). It may require some downtime (up to 30 minutes) of the site and needs to be scheduled. Please provide the details of the sitenames and a preferred workday you would like the change to occur and we can schedule it in. If you do decide to go ahead with the name change then we will produce an invoice and send it through to you for payment with all the confirmed details. And here is a list of resources you can use for help on any other Moodle topic:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Change of Moodle Cloud Site Name

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Forum stopped sending notifications
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Enrique, Sometimes when MoodleCloud are running upgrades there will be a delay to emails being sent. We've been running upgrades on and off for the past few days to deploy some additional server capacity and this will certainly be the cause of these delays. We should be finished with these upgrades before end of day today and all outbound emails will catch up. Sorry for the impact here (we do try to minimise these events as much as possible), but I think this draws attention to how we could better communicate when there are known delays to outbound emails (such as getting this information up on status.moodlecloud.com). I'll pick this up with the team. Thanks! Lee Goldsworthy Product Manager - MoodleCloud

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: When will MoodleCloud update to 3.9?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Larry, It will depend if you are using the Boost, School theme or Classic theme whether the add H5P button will appear or not in the Navigation drawer. Boost Theme: Go to the Content bank , accessible when in a course from the Navigation drawer. Click the Add button and select the activity you want. School Theme: Turn editing on within the course you want to add H5P Click Add an activity or resource and select H5P Click the Add button and select the activity you want. You can also manage and edit H5P content from Site Administration > H5P. For more information, see Content bank , H5P and H5P Activity . I hope this helps!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: When will MoodleCloud update to 3.9?
ResponsesInList.Text: In addition to what Frances says, if you are using the School theme on your MoodleCloud site then the Content bank link (where you can create new H5P content) will appear in the Site pages link of the Navigation block.

I was able to find a statement from BigBlueButton developer that: ===== There is no default time limit on BigBlueButton conferences or

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton 1 hour session limit
ResponsesInList.Text: You are referring to two things based on the same source code. You appear to be using an installation of BigBlueButton hosted by someone other than yourselves. If you were to download the code and host it yourself you could run it without any limitations. However that would be a great deal of time trouble and effort and you would be better off finding the cost of some other plan that did not limit you. Disclaimer: I have never installed BBB, don't run it myself, but have met the main person behind it who is awesome.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle and the Great Firewall of China
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Moodlers, First things first, thank you for this opportunity to become part of the community, I am new here. A bit of background, we are a Spanish online school, on the early stages yet, targeting Chinese users in Mainland China (other geographies will come later, hopefully). We had an LMS with an integrated virtual classroom until very recently, which worked fine mostly, but at times, users in China had problems logging in, loading documents, etc. The company that provided this "white-label-solution", based in India, had the servers in the US, and used AWS to deliver content globally, the closest to China being Hong Kong. After reading a lot online, we came to realize that the best solution for us would probably be to host our e-learning platform (LMS+ web conferencing tool) inside of China, to avoid being blocked or slowed down by the firewall. This is where MOODLE comes into play. A few days ago I discovered MoodleCloud, which with the paid option for schools would be quite interesting for us (easy set up, no technical requirements and affordable). We are a small team, with a limited budget and no IT department, so we need a ready-to-go solution, which MoodleCloud seems to offer perfectly (with its limits of course). PROBLEM? MoodleCloud can be hosted only in Australia, US and Ireland (we chose Ireland for our free account, just to play around and become familiar with the system). Not having our own domain is not a huge deal, since the Moodle LMS could be accessed from our own WordPress, so students would not need to type "example.moodle.school" to access the system. We have already contacted the only Moodle Partner in China, to consider what the options from their side are, but haven't got much info yet. We have our website hosted with "Mochahost" in the US, and they use CloudFlare (linked to our website) to reach 150+ data centers worldwide, including a few inside of China. The question is, considering all these things: our limited budget, technical ability, time, and users location (China mainly and other countries too) would it be possible to host MoodleCloud inside of China or host it with our WP site and use cloudflare to try and deliver content to mainland China? We also need it to be integrated with BigBlueButton to have the actual live classes, and recordings as well (does BBB need to be hosted separately to have disk space for recordings or is it hosted together with MC?). I know this is a tricky situation, so any help we could receive from the community would be much appreciated. Thanks a lot in advance, Alex

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and the Great Firewall of China
ResponsesInList.Text: Moving, I suppose, to the MoodleCloud forum...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and the Great Firewall of China
ResponsesInList.Text: I think it is unlikely the GFW will set out to block your site. However, the GFW works by preventing users within the mainland from connecting to IP addresses and if a closely related IP address has content judged to be unsuitable, a whole range of sites can be blocked. You would be the innocent bystander. In addition there are times when there is an internetÂ  crackdown - usually a party conferenceÂ  or times when the Party feels vulnerable to criticism. If the unrest in Hong Kong leads to action against the protests, a lot more sites may get blocked. It is a real risk. All you can do is change IP addresses if you are blocked.Â  If you are the target, your new site will be blocked asÂ  well. Otherwise your site will be able to be accessed from inside China. Getting a .com.cnÂ  address would probably help but Moodlecloud does not have that option. My sites have usually been in the US or Singapore and I have had to switch IP address a couple of times. Check with your provider how easy it is to do this. The US West Coast is a good option. with lower costs and fat cables across the Pacific. What do the engineers say? Cheap, reliable, requires little technical knowledge. You get 2 out of 3 with Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and the Great Firewall of China
ResponsesInList.Text: Sad to hear that China is not blessed by the Cloud. At least not the good ones. There are plenty of clouds of the other sorts, right now over Hong Kong. Anyway, coming back to the problem, if the users are behind the Great Wall, it is most logical for me to host the server behind it too. I would access the site through a VPN. For details see these previous discussions: - https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=388214 - https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=387806 - https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=277771 found through the search function https://moodle.org/mod/forum/search.php?id=5 .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and the Great Firewall of China
ResponsesInList.Text:
Registering a Chinese website is not as simple as it is for most countries. Set up a Subsidiary in China Whether to set up oneâ€™s own website, or open a store presence on Chinese e-commerce platforms such as Tmall and JD.com, investors will first need to set up a subsidiary in China. A
scan of the companyâ€™s business license needs to be submitted when
completing the website registration and filing procedures with the MIIT. (Chinese Ministry of Industry and Information) They ask for A completed .CN domain application form A copy of the business License (registered in China) A copy of the signatoryâ€™s national ID. Note that the signatory must be a Chinese citizen and has a valid PRC personal ID. I have always picked up a cheap domain nameÂ  and taken my chances. Depends on your budget.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and the Great Firewall of China
ResponsesInList.Text: The Great Firewall (GFW) of China is known as a filtering system, which edits the Internet and stops users from visiting numerous webpages and social media platforms. Since Internet censorship under the GFW is inescapable in China, utilizing a VPN to bypass it is vital. To evade the Great Firewall of China, just Sign up for a VPN service like VyprVPN provides a number of dissimilar VPN protocols, such as proprietary Chameleon technology that overthrows VPN blocking. Go for https://vpn.review/avoid-gfw-china/ this site to learn more about bypassing The Great Firewall of China . Just go for the guidelines for downloading your VPN and direct the app on your chosen device(s). Now log in with your credentials, and pick which server to interconnect to. VyprVPN allows you to pick from over 70 server locations all around the world, so you can choose a location free of censorship. Utilize the Internet or your applications as you normally do, and go for an open, free and Internet experience.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and the Great Firewall of China
ResponsesInList.Text: I have previously tried to register a bank account in Hong Kong, and the issue seems to be similar. However, this didn't require to be a citizen but physically visit HK. Have you tried to do it through the HK company? - I bet its much easier. Due to the new security law , I am however very cautious doing anything in that region. This is too unstable (especially if you are a U.S citizen). And just to mix up the discussion a bit, I found another research which might be useful for you. Most likely you have solved the issue by now, if not, keep us posted.

ResponsesInList.Title: How to manually delete uploaded files or images?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Am currently on the MoodleCloud School Plan with 400mb of limited file storage. Would like to check, is there a way to manually delete the files that were previously uploaded? e.g. pdfs, image files etc I've been checking the forums, and it seems there is no way to delete files currently in MoodleCloud. Can anyone confirm that this is true?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to manually delete uploaded files or images?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, This is an unfortunate limitation due to the way the Moodle LMS handles files. MoodleCloud offers a files list plugin to help mitigate the issue. You can access it at: https://[YOURSITE].moodle.school/admin/tool/fileslist/ The "View in context " button can typically get you to the course that the file is used in; which will hopefully help you track it down and allow you to delete it. Note that it is not always possible to determine what context a file is used in, which is why the button is not always present. Sorry that it's not the easiest process. Cheers, Cam

Imposing a file storage limit, and not giving customers the ability to delete files is illogical and a major inconvenience. I hope there is a plan in place to allow customers the ability to delete the files manually, is this in the roadmap for implementation in the near term (within the next 3 months)? Thanks, David

ResponsesInList.Title: Users email being updated to add .invalid at the end
ResponsesInList.Text: I've noticed that if a Moodle user has an out of office on their account and Moodle tries to send them a notification their email address in the user gets updated to <<email address>>.invalid We're using Moodle Cloud . Any idea why this is happening?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Users email being updated to add .invalid at the end
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sam, If your site sends a message to a user and a "bounce" is detected (per our email provider's rules), the '.invalid' is added to prevent further emails being sent out to that person. This is required to prevent all MoodleCloud email being flagged as spam . If you believe this has been done erroneously, please open a support request from the MoodleCloud Portal , providing the email address, and we'll be able to investigate further. Mathieu

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Users email being updated to add .invalid at the end
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks I've done a test and it looks like it's happening when there's an out of office on the email address, which is causing us a few issues.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is LTI integration possible with MoodleCloud? Full list of plugins?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Allie, LTI should work with MoodleCloud just as well as it does on the self-hosted version, but we are unfortunately not able to teach each plugin as part of MoodleCloud, and no such list has been compiled so far. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: database 1 GB
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Margherita, Based on other replies, I believe there's some confusion here. The file upload limit, in Moodle, is set to 1 MB per default. This can be increased by editing your course settings (look for "Maximum upload size"). You can also update the default in the admin section of your site (search for "maxbytes" or go to https://YOURSITE.moodlecloud.com/admin/settings.php?section=coursesettings ) Please note that some modules, like Assignement, have their own "maximum submission size". This one can be changes, system-wide, on https://YOURSITE.moodlecloud.com/admin/settings.php?section=assignsubmission_file The 1 GB limit for file storage has nothing to do with the database . It only applies to files "on disk". As suggested by William in this thread, you can use Youtube and embed the videos. If using a public system like youtube is not acceptable, I would suggest setting up Google Drive as repository (involves more work, but the files are private and do not count in your quota). More information on https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=353447#p1436755 Mathieu

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Accessing Moodle Cloud directory files
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rap, MoodleCloud offers a list of all files that are counting towards your quota which you can access by clicking on the "USERS" and "QUOTA" graph at the top right of any page (next the messaging icon), and then clicking "See all". From here the list can (in some cases) take you to the rough location in Moodle where those files are used; which should help you delete the files (by clicking the "View in context " button). Unfortunately due to the way Moodle stores files it is not always possible to show precisely where they are used. Cheers, Cam

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodlecloud Deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Skyler, Sorry to hear you have lost your MoodleCloud site. Under our free site retention policy, if your Moodle for Free site has been inactive for more than 14 days, it is removed in order to maintain a vibrant and active system for all users. We do send a reminder email message before the site is removed. Your site - rezeeltraining.moodlecloud.com was deleted on the 29th May 2020. To get the site back online, our technical team are able to restore your site data but as this is performed by our technical team there is a fee of $100.00 AUD. Also, please note that to comply with our GDPR policies, as you are no longer as a customer, you will need to reply to this message for us to go ahead with the site restore within 14 days of the site deletion date or your site will be deleted from our systems. Your other option is to recreate your site. You can do this in the MoodleCloud Portal or by completing the signup. Unfortunately, the content of the site has been deleted. To ensure it does not get removed in the future you need to make sure it is accessed regularly or you can choose to upgrade your site to a Starter or Moodle for School plan where the inactive policy does not apply. If you do decide to go ahead with the site restore, please reply to this message and we will produce an invoice and send it through to you for payment with all the confirmed details. If you have any further questions, please let me know or visit our FAQ page. Kind regards,

ResponsesInList.Title: MoodleCloud performance issues in AU region
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi folks, We've had some unexpected demand spikes in the AU region in the last few days that far exceeded our forecasting for planned capacityÂ upgrades. This has resulted in performance degradation for all sites in this region between 00:00 and 08:00 (GMT+0) on Tuesday, Wednesday and today. New capacity was succesfully provisioned on 2020-06-04 03:00 GMT+0,Â and services are in the process of returning to normal performance now.Â  The ETA for completion is 2020-06-04 07:00 GMT+0. This is the second time in 3 months we've had customer-impacting performance issues within specific regions of MoodleCloud, and I again want to acknowledge that we're not meeting our expectations or yours. We're nearing completion on architectural changes that will allow us to be a lot more responsive to performance/capacity issues in our ecosystem, and when these are in place in early July, we will be able to respond to events like this in minutes (rather than days). I want to thank you for your patience, and to let you know that every month we're working on both short-term and long-term changes to get closer to the kind of offering we and you expect from us. As always, you can get the latest information on active incidents over at status.moodlecloud.com . Cheers Lee Goldsworthy Product Manager - MoodleCloud

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud performance issues in AU region

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleCloud performance issues in AU region
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there! MoodleCloud is a SaaS product, which means the plugins we make available for all customers are the only plugins that can be used. Sadly there are no proctoring solutions available right now, but we are adding new plugins all the time, and proctoring is something we're looking at in the next 12 months. You can see the plugins available in MoodleCloud by clicking "etra plugin packs" on this page: https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/ If you require a hosting solution that allows you to install your own plugins (such as proctoru, proctortack), please connect with a Moodle Partner who can assist! https://moodle.com/partners/ Thanks! Lee

ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for the response. We are not programmers and therefore cannot take advantage of Open source tools. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Respondus 4.0 and Moodle Cloud
ResponsesInList.Text: I have no official capacity in this forum. Just saw that your enquiry is waiting and responded because of the urgency. The people who manage Moodle Cloud will join soon, I hope. The Moodle for Schools plan doesn't offer the Respondus connectivity, I'm afraid. See the last line "Plug-in and theme installation" in https://moodlecloud.com/app . Also "mouse-over" the question mark there. But there is no reason for panic. Taking a Moodle site from one server to another is quick (for the routined). It is called https://docs.moodle.org/en/Moodle_migration . If you upgrade you Moodle to a Moodle Partner they will handle that for you. They are the same company. It is worth clarifying with your content providers whether the Respondus component is a must. Moodle has a complete work-flow in itself for on-line exams, from the very simple ones to higher education. No programming is necessary. Neither does the Open Source component Safe Exam Browser I mentioned. It is a stripped-down browser and a kiosk system for the students computers to restrict many ways of cheating.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle EULA
ResponsesInList.Text: We use MoodleCloud for our courses and allow our users to self-register. Â When a new user logs in the first time, they are immediately hit with the two Moodle EULAs with no explanation of what it is and why it is necessary. It confuses many first time users, particularly if they are not particularly computer literate. Â I think it is overly intimidating without the ability to at least presenting a screen that explains what they will see next and what they need to do. Alternatively, it would be nice to, like many software providers, have a less intrusive way for users to accept the EULAs without having to physically scroll down each and click accept. So my question is if there is currently a way for organizations that use Moodle as a platform for delivering content to allow for adjustments to the default way new users see the Moodle EULAs, and if so, where can I find documentation on that? Thank you very much.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: "I tried the 45 days "MoodleCloud Free Trial". I did not like it. I want to have my money back."
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Omar, Thank you for contacting MoodleCloud support. Sorry to hear about your disappointment in your MoodleCloud site. I have refunded your subscription renewal. I will send the credit note separately for your records. Your site has now been suspended and will be removed from our systems in 30 days. Make sure you take a backup of your site and courses so you can come back and use it again in the future.; You can find your MoodleCloud export feature in your MoodleCloud Portal. The MoodleCloud Portal is where you manage your MoodleCloud account, billing details and access statistics on the usage of your site. To log in to the MoodleCloud Portal, enter your site URL and your MoodleCloud password, which is the same as the admin password for your MoodleCloud site. ( https://moodlecloud.com/en/ Login at the top right-hand corner) You can also create course backup s within your MoodleCloud site, learn more about course backups in our Moodle Documentation. Thank you for using MoodleCloud services and we hope to see you again soon. Kind regards, Craig R Morton Analyst Developer, MoodleCloud

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Free Moodle Site Gone; Frequently-used; Seeking answers
ResponsesInList.Text: Mary, This is a problem that I am trying to deal with. Our organization transitioned their email system in the last year. The email account associated with our Moodle site was deprecated, and we never updated it in Moodle. Therefore, no one received an update/warning, and the old emails are inaccessible. This is the catch-22. I am working on finding a way to prove that we used the site in the 60 day window, but I was away from work for that entire window of time. - Wilson

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Free Moodle Site Gone; Frequently-used; Seeking answers
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Wilson, I have checked our logs and can see that we sent a warning of site removal to your "volunteercoordinator" email on "2020-03-26 15:53:46". Also, it's worth pointing out that we moved from a 60 idle site timer to a 14 day idle site timer in February. All owners of free sites were emailed about this change, however if you lost access to your email registered with us then you would not have received it. There is also a sticky forum post on here about it, but if you have not logged on to this forum, again, you would not have seen it. Unfortunately, considering the time past since deletion, your site has been removed from our system entirely with no way to restore it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Manage embedded files always warns me that all files are missing
ResponsesInList.Text: hi, I'm using Moodlecloud based on Moodle version 3.8.1 (Build: 20200113). If I click on the Manage embedded files button (page editing - TinyMCE editor) I notice that all embedded files are reported missing . On the contrary, I see those files correctly shown in the text area. If I click the Update the list of missing or unused files button, nothing happens and I'm always warned that all the files are missing. This happens on all pages. With previous versions of Moodlecloud, the Manage embedded files tool worked well and it only warned me of truly missing files. What happens? Thanks, Luigi

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Manage embedded files always warns me that all files are missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Luigi, Can you please attach some screenshots of the issue? If you could let us know your site name that would be helpful too. Cheers, Cam

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Manage embedded files always warns me that all files are missing
ResponsesInList.Text: hi, I have attached a screenshot, with some text written on it, in red ink. Luigi

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Manage embedded files always warns me that all files are missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Luigi, I think you have found a bug in moodle's TinyMCE implementation. When I test the equivalent button in atto, it does not list unreferenced files. You can probably safely ignore the message (normally it displays to inform you that there are within the textarea which not referenced anywhere (and thus might deleting them might be desirable)). You can avoid the issue entirely by using the atto editor. Or if you'd like it to be fixed in a future version of Moodle, you can file a bug report at: https://tracker.moodle.org - be sure to include detailed replication instructions. Cheers, Cam

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Manage embedded files always warns me that all files are missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Cameron, thanks for answering. Until last year my text editor (TinyMCE) worked well, exactly as you outline here. Well, it should be a bug... I'll try to post a bug report, as you say. Bye, L.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodlecloud Website was deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi. As the subject says, my Moodlecloud website was deleted due to inactivity because I had to stop teaching the children I homeschool since I had a research project that had to be finished (University Student here btw ). By the time I was done with my research, physical distancing and stay-at-home orders were enforced because of Covid-19. I then received instructions I need to compile the children's outputs and grades (conveniently stored in Moodle) Two weeks ago I tried to access my website, it prompted that my site no longer exists! I immediately posted to support.moodle.com asking if it was possible to recover my website since I also had instructions to prepare to teach the children online, and until now, no reply from Moodle Support. Yes, I acknowledge that Moodle does send emails reminding me that I should frequently log in to my website, and I did receive those emails it didn't prompt since I sort them using the tabs in Gmail (crazy and lazy, I know). Any help from anyone is appreciated. Thanks! Alfonso

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodlecloud Website was deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alfonso, sorry to hear that you've lost your site! as you can imagine - the moodlecloud support team has been slammed in the past few months - with tens of thousands of new sites being created, and many people looking for support, and the support inbox for moodleclouds "free" sites has been hard for them to keep on top of. As you have found - if your "free" site isn't used it will be deleted - and unfortunately there isn't a process that allows you to recover this. The cost of maintaining backups for all the free sites and a process to restore them is just too high considering the massive number of free sites the moodlecloud system hosts. The best way to prevent this from happening in future would be for you to upgrade to one of the paid plans - the other thing that would be good for you to do is to use the Moodle course backup process and store a copy of your course backups locally. all the best!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodlecloud Website was deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dan, thank you for replying. It's sad to know that there isn't a way to recover my moodlecloud website. Thank you for the tips you've suggested on backing up and storing it locally. Continue being awesome. Again, thank you! Alfonso

ResponsesInList.Title: Migrate from MoodleCloud to Moodle Hosted
ResponsesInList.Text: How difficult is it to migrate from the MoodleCloud to a Moodle Hosted solution?Â  Currently, the MoodleCloud would meet our needs. However, we are rapidly growing. I foresee the need to bring it in house in a few years.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate from MoodleCloud to Moodle Hosted
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi David, The MoodleCloud portal features an easy way to let you export your site, which will give you a zip file containing your "data root" along with an sql dump or your site (you can export it in postgresql or mysql format). This is not hard to deploy on a server , but you will need either a Moodle Partner or some experience with administration of a Moodle server . Feel free to create a site and try an export right away to get a sense of how much trouble it would be for you.Mathieu

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrate from MoodleCloud to Moodle Hosted
